in: <entryFree id="n22144" type="main" key="i^n5"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-aequālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n22144.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Uneven</hi> (in <cb n="INAL" /> post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">loca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>not nicely finished</tr>, <tr>rough</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:56:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 56, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inaequalia et confragosa (sc loca),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inaequales beryllo Virro tenet phialas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:38" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 38</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22144.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Unequal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unlike</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post - Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">portus,</quote> <trans><tr>of different sizes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:408" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 408</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">triangula inaequalibus lateribus (opp. aequa),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:41" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">siccat inaequales calices conviva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctumni,</quote> <trans><tr>changeable</tr>, <tr>variable in temperature</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vixit inaequalis, clavum ut mutaret in horas,</quote> <trans><tr>inconstant</tr>, <tr>inconsistent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7</bibl></cit> 10: <cit><quote lang="la">stulti et inaequales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tonsor,</quote> <trans><tr>that cuts unevenly</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procellae,</quote> <trans><tr>that roughen the sea</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 9, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est ipsa aequalitate inaequalius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 5, 3</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inaequalissimarum rerum sortes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:75" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 75</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnaequālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">unevenly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disproportionately</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ova maturescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:9:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 9, 8</bibl></cit> Bonon. (al. inaequabiliter): <cit><quote lang="la">censuram gerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">findi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arbor. 7:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arbor. 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dispergere bracchia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deprimere alios, alios extollere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:53:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 53, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n22147" type="main" key="i^n6"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-aequātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22147.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unequal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">onus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:42" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 42</bibl></cit> (4, 1, 43).</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n22154" type="hapax" key="i^n7"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ăgĭtābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22154.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">immovable</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">aër (with iners),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:5:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 5, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inaequalitas: <entryFree id="n22145" type="main" key="i^naequa_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnaequālĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. in-aequalis</etym>, <sense id="n22145.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unevenness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unlikeness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inequality</hi> (not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n22145.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">togae et tunicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=28" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 28</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">inaequalitate dissident (supercilia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:79" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coloris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:9:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 9, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:43" default="NO">11, 3, 43</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:12:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 12, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 70, 70, § 177</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n22145.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">grammatical irregularity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anomaly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 3</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:25:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 25, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inaequaliter: <entryFree id="n22146" type="main" key="i^naequa_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnaequālĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. inaequalis <sense id="n22146.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
inaequo: <entryFree id="n22148" type="main" key="i^naequo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-aequo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n22148.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make even</hi> or <hi rend="ital">level</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec levibus cratibus terraque inaequat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:27:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 27, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inaestimabilis: <entryFree id="n22149" type="main" key="i^naesti^ma_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-aestĭmābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n22149.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">that cannot be estimated</hi> or <hi rend="ital">judged of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil tam incertum nec tam inaestimabile est quam animi multitudinis,</quote> <trans><tr>so little to be counted upon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:34:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 34, 3</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n22149.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n22149.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Inestimable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invaluable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incalculable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod e grege se imperatorum, velut inaestimabilem, secrevisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:14:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 14, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:32:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 32, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">monumentum occasionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:8:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 8, 1</bibl></cit>. — * </sense><sense id="n22149.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Not worthy to be esteemed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">valueless</hi>, opp. aestimabile, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:6:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 6, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inaestimatus: <entryFree id="n22150" type="main" key="i^naesti^ma_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-aestĭmātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22150.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not rated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">untaxed</hi> (jurid. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">fundus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:25:3:75" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 25, 3, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pretia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inaestuo: <entryFree id="n22151" type="main" key="i^naestu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-aestŭo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n22151.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to boil</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rage in</hi> any thing (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">bilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:11:15" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 11, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">succensi stomacho fellis inaestuans (impietas),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> adv. Symm. 1</bibl></cit>, praef. 58.</sense></entryFree>
inaffectatus: <entryFree id="n22152" type="main" key="i^naffecta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-affectātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22152.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unaffected</hi>, <hi rend="ital">natural</hi> (post-Aug.): <foreign lang="greek">a)fe/leia</foreign> simplex et inaffectata, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:87" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 87</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">color (with simplex),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 1, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jucunditas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veritas verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:67:1 al" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 67, 1 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
inaggeratus: <entryFree id="n22153" type="main" key="i^nagge^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnaggĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-aggero</etym>, <sense id="n22153.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">heaped up</hi>: tellus, Sid. poët. Ep. 3, 12.</sense></entryFree>
inagitatus: <entryFree id="n22155" type="main" key="i^na^gi^ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ăgĭtātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22155.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unmoved</hi> (post - Aug.). </sense><sense id="n22155.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">inagitata remigio vastitas (maris),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Suas. 1:section=2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Suas. 1, § 2</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n22155.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">terroribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 75:13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 75, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inalbeo: <entryFree id="n22156" type="hapax" key="i^nalbe^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-albĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n22156.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be white</hi> or <hi rend="ital">light</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies inalbebat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit> p. 187 (perh. borrowed from Enn.; v. inalbo).</sense></entryFree>
inalbesco: <entryFree id="n22157" type="main" key="i^nalbesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-albesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n22157.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become white</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pale</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">venae inalbescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">totum corpus cum pallore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:24:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 24, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 28</bibl>, n. 1, 7.</sense></entryFree>
inalbo: <entryFree id="n22158" type="main" key="i^nalbo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-albo</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">ind-albo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n22158.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make white</hi> or <hi rend="ital">light</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to whiten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brighten</hi> (ante- and post-class.): ut primum tenebris abjectis indalbabat, Enn. ap. Achill. <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> ad Cat. 64, 40</bibl> (Ann. v. 219 Vahl.; perh. imitated by Appuleius; <cit><quote lang="la">v. inalbeo): cerei nocturnas tenebras inalbabant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 248, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inalgesco: <entryFree id="n22159" type="hapax" key="i^nalgesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-algesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n22159.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become cold</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">extremae partes membrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 3, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inalienatus: <entryFree id="n22160" type="main" key="i^na^li^e_na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ălĭēnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22160.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unspoiled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uncorrupted</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">propolis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 214" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 214</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inalpinus: <entryFree id="n22161" type="main" key="I^nalpi_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭn-alpīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22161.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">living upon</hi> <pb n="915" /> <cb n="INAN" /> <hi rend="ital">the Alps</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Alpine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">populi, Plin, 3, 5, 7, § 47: gentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 21</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Inalpīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">inhabitants of the Alps</hi>, Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 4, 5, § 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inaltero: <entryFree id="n22162" type="hapax" key="i^nalte^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-altĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n22162.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to include the one in the other</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quas non divisit, tacendo inalteravit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Virg. Vel. 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inalto: <entryFree id="n22163" type="main" key="i^nalto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-alto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n22163.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to raise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exalt</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n22163.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">inaltata est cava mundi rotunditas in modum sphaerae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Trism. p. 85, 41</bibl></cit> dub. — </sense><sense id="n22163.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui superbos deprimit, humiles inaltat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Carm. 21, 738</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inamabilis: <entryFree id="n22164" type="main" key="i^na^ma_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ămābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22164.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not worthy of love</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not lovely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repugnant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revolting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hateful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">odious</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">inamabilis, illepidus vivo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus ipsum inamabile, inamoenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tristique palus inamabilis undā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:438" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 438</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnum (of the Lower World),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:477" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 477</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">14, 590</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">feritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:6:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 1, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est inamabilius quam diligens stultitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 3:20" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 3, 20 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit> — In the <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> adverb.: <cit><quote lang="la">inamabile ridet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:289" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 289</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inamaresco: <entryFree id="n22165" type="hapax" key="i^na^ma_resco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ămāresco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n22165.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become bitter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">epulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 107</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inamarico: <entryFree id="n22166" type="main" key="i^na^ma_ri^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ămārĭco</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-amarus</etym>, <sense id="n22166.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to imbitter</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Psa. 5:15" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Psa. 5, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inamatus: <entryFree id="n22167" type="hapax" key="i^na^ma_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ămātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22167.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not loved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disliked</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:526" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 526</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inambitiosus: <entryFree id="n22168" type="hapax" key="i^nambi^ti^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ambĭtĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22168.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unambitious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unassuming</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:765" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 765</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inambulatio: <entryFree id="n22169" type="main" key="i^nambu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnambŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>inambulo</etym>. <sense id="n22169.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A walking up and down</hi> on the rostra (of orators; <cit><quote lang="la">rare but class.),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 15, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:43:158" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 43, 158</bibl>. — <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: tremuli lecti, <hi rend="ital">a moving</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shaking to and fro</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 6, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n22169.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a place to walk in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a walk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">promenade</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 1, 3, § 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inambulo: <entryFree id="n22170" type="main" key="i^nambu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ambŭlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n22170.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to walk up and down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pace to and fro</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">paululum in porticu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in viridi opacaque ripa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:5:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: cum quidam pransus ... manibus ad tergum rejectis inambularet, Asin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:32:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 32, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per muros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:43:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 43, 8</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inambulandumst,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 92</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inamissibilis: <entryFree id="n22171" type="main" key="i^na_missi^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-āmissĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22171.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be lost</hi> (late Lat.): voluntas pietatis, Aug. Civ. Dei, 22, 30 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></sense></entryFree>
inamoenus: <entryFree id="n22172" type="main" key="i^na^moenus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ămoenus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22172.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unpleasant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disagreeable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gloomy</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">regna (of the Lower World),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cocytos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:89" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">feritas viae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Silv. 2, 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id genus operis inamabile, inamoenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. Mon. 1</bibl></cit>. 1.</sense></entryFree>
inamplexibilis: <entryFree id="n22173" type="main" key="i^namplexi^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-amplexĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-amplector</etym>, <sense id="n22173.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not to be embraced</hi> or <hi rend="ital">contained in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">loco,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> in Psa. 17, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inanesco: <entryFree id="n22174" type="main" key="i^na_nesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnānesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n22174.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [inanis], <hi rend="ital">to become empty</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">conchulae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 6, 86</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:de Mus. 6:13" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> de Mus. 6, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inaniae: <entryFree id="n22175" type="hapax" key="i^na_ni^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnānĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22175.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">emptiness</hi> (comic): <cit><quote lang="la">inaniis sunt oppletae atque araneis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inanis pro inanitate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 123, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inanilogus: <entryFree id="n22176" type="spur" key="i^na_ni^lo^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnānĭlŏgus</orth>, false read. for inaniloquus.</entryFree>
inaniloquium: <entryFree id="n22177" type="main" key="i^na_ni^lo^qui^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnānĭlŏquĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n22177.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a vain talking</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">kenologi/a,</foreign> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,015:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Tim. 2, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inaniloquus: <entryFree id="n22178" type="main" key="i^na_ni^lo^quus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnānĭlŏquus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>inanis-loquor</etym>, <sense id="n22178.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that talks in vain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 24</bibl> Ritschl <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> cf. inaniloquus <foreign lang="greek">kenolo/gos,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
inanimalis: <entryFree id="n22179" type="main" key="i^na^ni^ma_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ănĭmālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22179.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lifeless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inanimate</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">omnia (opp. animalia),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Trism. p. 88</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 48</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inanimans: <entryFree id="n22180" type="main" key="i^na^ni^mans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ănĭmans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22180.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inanimate</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">aut animantia sunt aut inanimantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 58:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 58, 9</bibl></cit> (al. inanimata).</sense></entryFree>
inanimatus: <entryFree id="n22181" type="main" key="i^na^ni^ma_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ănĭmātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22181.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lifeless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inanimate</hi> (late Lat.), Boëth. Arist. Anal. Prior. 1, 4, p. 471 sq. (but not in Cicero; v. Madv. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:page=534 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. p. 534 sq.</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
inanimentum: <entryFree id="n22182" type="main" key="i^na_ni_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnānīmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>inanio</etym>, <sense id="n22182.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">emptiness</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inanimis: <entryFree id="n22183" type="main" key="i^na^ni^mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnănĭmis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-anima</etym>, <sense id="n22183.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">without breath</hi> or <hi rend="ital">without life</hi>, <hi rend="ital">breathless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lifeless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inanimate</hi> (Appuleian): <cit><quote lang="la">ventus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>that does not blow</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 103, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humi projectus, inanimis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> p. 108, 25; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2, p. 125, 41</bibl>. <cb n="INAN" /></sense></entryFree>
inanimus: <entryFree id="n22184" type="main" key="i^na^ni^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnănĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-animus</etym>, <sense id="n22184.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lifeless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inanimate</hi> (class.; cf. Madv. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:page=534" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. p. 534</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">cum inter inanimum et animal hoc maxime intersit, quod inanimum nihil agit, animal agit aliquid,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 12, 37</bibl></cit>; cf.: inanimum est omne, quod pulsu agitatur externo; <cit><quote lang="la">quod autem est animal, id motu cietur interiore et suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:23:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 23, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujusque generis vel inanimi vel animantis origo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 24, 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">res (opp. quodque animal),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:47:98" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 47, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:30:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 30, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muta atque inanima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:67:section=171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 67, § 171</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with muta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:14:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 14, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 69 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes res, animantes et inanimae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 48, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 53, 66</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex mutis animalibus aut inanimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:3:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 3, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satiati caede animantium, quae inanima erant, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 18, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inanio: <entryFree id="n22185" type="main" key="i^na_ni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnānĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi or ĭi, ītum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>inanis</etym>, <sense id="n22185.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make empty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to empty out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">evacuate</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">hoc ubi inanitur spatium, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1005" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1005</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">locus inanitus magis ac vacuatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1025" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 1025</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbacea arefacta per se inanit alvum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 3, 8, § 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vesicas (polium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 20, 84, § 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora (luna, opp. implet),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 98, 99, § 122</bibl></cit>.—<mood>Part.</mood> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnānītum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">vacancy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">emptiness</hi> (opp. plenum), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inanis: <entryFree id="n22186" type="main" key="i^na_nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnānis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>etym. dub.; cf. 2. in-</etym>, <sense id="n22186.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">empty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">void</hi> (opp. plenus; freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n22186.1" n="I" level="1"> Physically: <cit><quote lang="la">cum vas inane dicimus, non ita loquimur ut physici, quibus inane esse nihil placet, sed ita, ut verbi causa sine aqua, sine vino, sine oleo vas esse dicamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:11:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 11, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqualis inanis (opp. plena),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tune inane quicquam putes esse, cum ita completa et conferta sint omnia, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 40, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae spatium pleno possint distinguere inane,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:527" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 527</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum ejus exornatam et instructam, fere jam iste reddiderat nudam atque inanem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:34:section=84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 34, § 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">granum inane cassumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 17, 45, § 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (naves) inanes ad eum remitterentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:23:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 23, 4</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">naves (opp. onustae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 8, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 40, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:50:section=131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 50, § 131</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inde navigia inania et vacua hinc plena et onusta mittantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:31:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 31, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lagenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 26, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix incedo inanis, ne ire posse cum onere existimes,</quote> <trans><tr>without a burden</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 174</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ego bajulabo: tu, ut decet dominum, ante me ito inanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 3, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">janitor ad dantes vigilet: si pulset inanis Surdus, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>emptyhanded</tr>, <tr>without presents</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 5, 47: <cit><quote lang="la">hic homo est inanis,</quote> <trans><tr>without money</tr>, <tr>without fortune</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 75</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">misera in civitate et inani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:66:section=160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 66, § 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">egentes inanesque discedere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 9</bibl></cit>, § 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">structores ad frumentum profecti inanes redierunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equus,</quote> <trans><tr>without a rider</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:66:section=160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 66, § 160</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid, quod omnes consulares ... simul atque assedisti partem istam subselliorum nudam atque inanem reliquerunt?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">absint inani funere neniae,</quote> <trans><tr>without a corpse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:20:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 20, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parasitus,</quote> <trans><tr>unfed</tr>, <tr>hungry</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venter,</quote> <trans><tr>hungry</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 127</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">siccus, inanis Sperne cibum vilem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod inani sufficit alvo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:7" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laeva,</quote> <trans><tr>without rings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae,</quote> <trans><tr>empty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 22, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paleae,</quote> <trans><tr>empty</tr>, <tr>light</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubila,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 196</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:740" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 740</bibl></cit>: tum ebur ex inani corpore extractum (a transl. of the Platon. <foreign lang="greek">a)poleloipo/tos yuxh\n sw/matos</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">lifeless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dead</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:18:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 18, 45</bibl> Mos.: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 116</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 9, 6</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">in the foll.: vulgus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the shades</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:93" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 93</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">umbra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:11:25" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 11, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:463" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 5, 463</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regna Ditis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:269" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 269</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tartara,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:670" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 670</bibl></cit>: leo, <hi rend="ital">a lion</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s hide</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:483" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 483</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">tigris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 722</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>blind</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Phoen. 43" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Phoen. 43</bibl></cit>: Gaurus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">hollow</hi> (an extinct volcano), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:57" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 57</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n22186.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>, <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">ab</hi> (the last rare): <cit><quote lang="la">nulla epistula inanis aliqua re utili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Agyrinensis ager centum septuaginta aratoribus inanior est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:52:section=121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 52, § 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinis atque animi pectus inane,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 3, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus animae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:488" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 13, 488</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 611</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:18" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 18</bibl> (4, 17), 32: <cit><quote lang="la">lymphae dolium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 11, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectus deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:309" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 309</bibl></cit>: inanis a marsupio, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef.</foreign> 2, 104. — </sense><sense id="n22186.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <cb n="INAQ" /> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnāne</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an empty space</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a void</hi> (most freq. in Lucr.): <cit><quote lang="la">scilicet hoc id erit vacuum quod inane vocamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:439" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 439</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">namque est in rebus inane,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:330 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 330 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:569" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 569</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:236" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 236</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita nullum inane, nihil esse individuum potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:23:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 23, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plus esse inanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:365" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 365</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:524" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 524</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inane,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:369" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 369</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:426" default="NO" valid="yes">426</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:507" default="NO" valid="yes">507</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">514 et saep.: ad inane naturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 1, 4, § 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per inane,</quote> <trans><tr>through the air</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1018" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1018</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 65</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:906" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 906</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 43, 68, § 169</bibl> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Abl.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:742" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 742</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1009" default="NO" valid="yes">1009</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab inani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:431" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 431</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in inani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1078" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 1078</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:122" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 122</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine inani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:510" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 510</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:532" default="NO" valid="yes">532</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:538" default="NO" valid="yes">538</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per inania,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 223</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:506" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 506</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n22186.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n22186.5" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">empty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">useless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worthless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unprofitable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures ipsae, quid plenum, quid inane sit judicant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:8:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 8, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod honestum nos et laudabile esse dicamus, id illi cassum quiddam et inani vocis sono decoratum esse dicant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:41:119" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 41, 119</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">honesti inane nomen esse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 22, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sin vera visa divina sunt, falsa autem et inania humana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:62:127" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 62, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voces inanes fundere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:18:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 18, 42</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">elocutio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">damnatus inani judicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:47" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 2, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:100" default="NO">9, 3, 100</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">verborum torrenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:72:section=177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 72, § 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o inanes nostras contentiones!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o spes fallaces et cogitationes inanes meae!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:34:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 34, 94</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inani et tenui spe te consolaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:14:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 14, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:627" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 627</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">religio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delectari multis inanibus rebus, ut gloriā, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:14:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 14, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">23, 86</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupiditates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:13:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 13, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causas nequidquam nectis inanes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 219</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:6:3" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus inane peto, requiem spatiumque furori,</quote> <trans><tr>vacant</tr>, <tr>leisure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:433" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 433</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ternpora (with morae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:657" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 657</bibl></cit>: tempora, in prosody, i. q. the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">keno\s xro/nos,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">the use of a short syllable for a long one</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:51" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 51</bibl> Spald.—</sense><sense id="n22186.6" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia plena consiliorum, inania verborum,</quote> <trans><tr>poor in words</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:9:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 9, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae inanissima prudentiae reperta sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 12, 26</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22186.7" n="B" level="2"> Of persons, <hi rend="ital">vain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worthless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">petty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:639" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 639</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo inanis et regiae superbiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 64:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 64, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imagines, quibus inanissimi homines serviunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 17, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inanes Hoc juvat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 76</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:23:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 23, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:639" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 639</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hi pressi et integri, contra inflati illi et inanes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">illud vero pusilli animi et inanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 17, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non negaverim totam Asiae regionem inaniora parere ingenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:23:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 23, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22186.8" n="C" level="2"> As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnāne</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">that which is empty</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vain; emptiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vanity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inanity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">o curas hominum! o quantum est in rebus inane!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:1" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inane abscindere soldo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 113</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum vitat humum, nubes et inania captet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 230</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inaina famae,</quote> <trans><tr>idle reports</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inania belli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 69</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnānĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">vainly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">idly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uselessly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsultare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:6:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moveri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 15, 47</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 11, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectus angere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 211</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicas exercet inaniter artes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:618" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 618</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inanitas: <entryFree id="n22187" type="main" key="i^na_ni^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnānĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>inanis</etym>. <sense id="n22187.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">emptiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">empty space</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">mihi inanitate Jamdudum intestina murmurant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per inanitatem ferri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:9:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 9, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 11, 6</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22187.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">emptiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uselessness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inanity</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">amputata circumcisaque inanitate omni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:13:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 13, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:2:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 2, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum et imaginum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:8:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 8, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inaniter: <entryFree id="n22188" type="main" key="i^na_ni^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnānĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. inanis <sense id="n22188.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
inanitio: <entryFree id="n22189" type="main" key="i^na_ni_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnānītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>inanis</etym>, <sense id="n22189.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">emptiness</hi> (opp. repletio), <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 4, 6, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inanitus: <entryFree id="n22190" type="main" key="i^na_ni_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnānītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from inanio.</entryFree>
inapertus: <entryFree id="n22191" type="hapax" key="i^na^pertus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ăpertus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22191.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not open</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fraudique inaperta senectus,</quote> <trans><tr>not exposed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:26" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inapparatio: <entryFree id="n22192" type="hapax" key="i^nappa^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-appărātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n22192.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">want of preparation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 4, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inapprehensibilis: <entryFree id="n22193" type="main" key="i^nappre^hensi^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-apprĕhensĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22193.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">incomprehensible</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:3:38" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 3, 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Herm. 43 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
inaquo: <entryFree id="n22194" type="hapax" key="i^na^quo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ăquo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n22194.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to turn into water</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nutrimenta corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:14:118" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 14, 118</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inaquosus: <entryFree id="n22195" type="main" key="i^na^quo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ăquōsus</orth> <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22195.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lacking water</hi><pb n="916" /> <cb n="INAS" />  (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">loca,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: inaquosus <foreign lang="greek">a)/nudros,</foreign> Gloss. Cyril.— As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnăquōsa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">dry places</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desert places</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpentes arida et inaquosa sectantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Bapt. 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inaratus: <entryFree id="n22196" type="main" key="i^na^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ărātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22196.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unploughed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">untilled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fallow</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:43" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diu Pangaea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:512" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 512</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inarcto: <entryFree id="n22197" type="main" key="i^narcto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnarcto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-arctus</etym>, <sense id="n22197.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to circumscribe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">limit</hi> ( post - class. ), Aug. contr. Ep. Manich. 25, 27.</sense></entryFree>
inarculum: <entryFree id="n22198" type="gloss" key="inarcu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inarcŭlum</orth> <itype>virgula erat ex malo Punico incurvata, quam regina sacrificans in capite gestabat</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=113" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 113</bibl> Müll. <sense id="n22198.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> [in-arcus].</sense></entryFree>
inardesco: <entryFree id="n22199" type="main" key="i^nardesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ardesco</orth>, <itype>arsi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n22199.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch.n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to kindle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take fire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glow</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n22199.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubes Solis inardescit radiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:623" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 623</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbusculae in igne ut ferrum inardescentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 25, 51, § 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec munus (i. e. vestis) umeris Herculis Inarsit aestuosius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:3:18" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inardescunt genae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 251" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 251</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n22199.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">affectus omnis languescat necesse est, nisi voce, vultu, totius prope habitu corporis inardescat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupidine vindictae inardescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vidit juvenem, specie praesentis inarsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 83</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inarefactus: <entryFree id="n22200" type="hapax" key="i^na_re^factus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ārĕfactus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22200.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dried</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis ranarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 10, 42, § 121</bibl></cit> dub.</sense></entryFree>
inaresco: <entryFree id="n22201" type="main" key="i^na_resco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-āresco</orth>, <itype>ārui, 3</itype>, <sense id="n22201.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become dry in</hi> any place, <hi rend="ital">to dry up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">become quite dry</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n22201.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in sole,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8.40, § 66</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: caenum illitum sole,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 6, 32, § 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicamenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructus ante maturitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:24:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 24, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">germina multa cum inaruere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 11, 71, § 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil facilius quam lacrimas inarescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 27</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22201.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to dry up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">become exhausted</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne (liberalitas) nimia profusione inarescat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 4, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inargento: <entryFree id="n22202" type="main" key="i^nargento"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-argento</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-argentum</etym>, <sense id="n22202.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to overlay with silver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to silver</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 25, 5</bibl></cit>. — Mostly <mood>Part.</mood>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnargentātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">overlaid with silver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">silvered over</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">lamina aerea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 2, 3, § 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:10:3 praef" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 10, 3 praef.</bibl></cit> § 3.</sense></entryFree>
inargute: <entryFree id="n22203" type="main" key="i^nargu_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnargūtē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. inargutus <sense id="n22203.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
inargutus: <entryFree id="n22204" type="main" key="i^nargu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-argūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22204.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not acute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without acuteness</hi> (post - class.): <cit><quote lang="la">sententia non inarguta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:5:5:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 5, 5, § 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">in-argūtē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">not acutely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non mehercule inargute nec incallide opposuisti hoc Tullianum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:13:19" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 13, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inarime: <entryFree id="n22205" type="main" key="I_na^ri^me_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Īnărĭmē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ei)n *)ari/mois</foreign> (Hom. Il. 2, 783), <sense id="n22205.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island in the Tyrrhene Sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the coast of Campania</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Ischia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 6, 12, § 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:716" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 716</bibl> Heyne; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:208" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 208</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:2:76" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 2, 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:148" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 148</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 101</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Inarime a Graecis dicta Pithecusa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 644</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inarmo: <entryFree id="n22206" type="main" key="i^narmo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-armo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n22206.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to arm</hi> (eccl. Lat.), Ven. Fort. Vit. Leob. 7.</sense></entryFree>
inaro: <entryFree id="n22207" type="main" key="i^na^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ăro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n22207.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to plough in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cover by ploughing.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22207.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sarmenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 37, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabalia pro stercore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:23" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 23</bibl></cit>. 3; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">disjectum fimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:5:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semina abjecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 18, 47, § 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 11</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n22207.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n22207.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To plough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">till</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cultivate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 14, 36, § 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:23:9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 23, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22207.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To enter</hi> or <hi rend="ital">write in a list</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Commod.</author> 70, 15</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n22207.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To mark</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stigmatibus vultum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Exhort. Virg. 12, § 83</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inarticulatus: <entryFree id="n22208" type="main" key="i^narti^cu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-artĭcŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22208.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">indistinct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inarticulate</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 537</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
inartificialis: <entryFree id="n22209" type="main" key="i^narti^fi^ci^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-artĭfĭcĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22209.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inartificial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not according to the rules of art</hi> (post-Aug.): illas (probationes) <foreign lang="greek">a)te/xnous,</foreign> id est inartificiales; has <foreign lang="greek">e)nte/xnous,</foreign> id est artificiales vocaverunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:1:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">probationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:5:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 5, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 10, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">argumenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 474</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">§ 557</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">§ 560</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnartĭfĭ-cĭālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">inartificially</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se gerere (opp. artificialiter),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:42" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 17, 42</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inascensus: <entryFree id="n22210" type="hapax" key="i^nascensus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ascensus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22210.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not mounted</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ascended</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus (rostra),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:65:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 65, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inaspectus: <entryFree id="n22211" type="hapax" key="i^naspectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-aspectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22211.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unseen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:50" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 50</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inaspicabilis: <entryFree id="n22212" type="gloss" key="i^naspi^ca_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnaspĭcābĭlis</orth> <foreign lang="greek">a)o/ratos,</foreign> Gloss. Philox. <cb n="INAU" /></entryFree>
inaspicuus: <entryFree id="n22213" type="hapax" key="i^naspi^cu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-aspĭcŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22213.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">invisible</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">notae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 23, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inassatus: <entryFree id="n22214" type="main" key="i^nassa_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnassātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [in-asso], <sense id="n22214.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">roasted</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">pulmo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 8, 22, § 74</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:88" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 10, 27, § 88</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inassero: <entryFree id="n22215" type="gloss" key="i^nasse^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnassĕro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-asser</etym>, <sense id="n22215.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cover with beams</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 207, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inassignatus: <entryFree id="n22216" type="main" key="i^nassigna_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-assignātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22216.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unassigned</hi> (post class.): <cit><quote lang="la">inodus agrorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aggen.</author> p. 70</bibl></cit> Goes.</sense></entryFree>
inassuetus: <entryFree id="n22217" type="main" key="i^nassu^e_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-assŭētus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22217.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unaccustomed</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">equi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:450" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 450</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:300" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 300</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at vestigia nuda sinusque Cingere, inassuetum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>unusual</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:236" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 236</bibl></cit>: opere inassueto Galliis, Fragm. Or. Claud. ap. Grut. 502, 2, 37.</sense></entryFree>
inattaminatus: <entryFree id="n22218" type="main" key="i^natta_mi^na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnattāmĭnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. inattamino</etym>, <sense id="n22218.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">uninjured</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unhurt</hi>, Tert. de Cor. Mil. c. ult.</sense></entryFree>
inattenuatus: <entryFree id="n22219" type="hapax" key="i^natte^nu^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-attĕnŭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22219.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">undiminished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unweakened</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fames,</quote> <trans><tr>unappeased</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:846" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 846</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inattritus: <entryFree id="n22220" type="hapax" key="i^nattri_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-attrītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22220.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not rubbed away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not worn</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 10, 254</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inaudax: <entryFree id="n22221" type="hapax" key="i^naudax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-audax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22221.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not daring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">timorous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">raptor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 20, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inaudibilis: <entryFree id="n22222" type="hapax" key="i^naudi_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-audībĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22222.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inaudible</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">melodia nobis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> D. 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inaudientia: <entryFree id="n22223" type="main" key="i^naudi^enti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-audĭentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n22223.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">disobedience</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cypr.</author> Ep. 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inaudio: <entryFree id="n22224" type="main" key="i^naudi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-audĭo</orth> (arch. <orth extent="full" lang="la">ind-audio</orth>, cf. Ritschl Proleg. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> p. 143</bibl>), īvi or <itype>ĭi, ītum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n22224.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to hear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">learn</hi>, esp. something secret (mostly ante-class. and in the <hi rend="ital">tempp. perff.</hi>): quod ego inaudivi, accipite, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 126, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde hoc tam repente jucundum inaudivi melum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0594,001:ib. 21" default="NO"><author>Nov.</author> ib. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum erupit illa vox de qua ego ex te primum quiddam inaudieram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,062:ib. 20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fragm. ib. 20</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">numquid de quo inaudisti?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metus ne de hac re quippiam indaudiverit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 11</bibl></cit>;
