<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 100</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">103</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam os columnatum poëtae esse indaudivi barbaro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 88</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et Aquini et Fabrateriae consilia sunt inita de me quae te video inaudisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 24, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">re denique multo ante Gadibus inaudita, fore huic ut ab illo periculum crearetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:18:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 18, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inaudita sententia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:3:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 22, 3, 7</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: bonis dictis, quaeso, ne ille inaudiat, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 126, 25</bibl> (Com. Rel. p. 149 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
inauditiuncula: <entryFree id="n22225" type="hapax" key="i^naudi_ti^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-audītĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl>, <sense id="n22225.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little lecture</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lesson</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">disciplinae grammaticae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:21:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 21, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inauditus: <entryFree id="n22226" type="main" key="i^naudi_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnaudītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from inaudio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n22227" type="main" key="i^naudi_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-audītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22227.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unheard.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22227.1" n="I" level="1"> (On account of its novelty or strangeness.) <hi rend="ital">Unheard-of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unusual</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strange</hi>, <hi rend="ital">new</hi> (freq. and class.; <cit><quote lang="la">a favorite word of Cic.): nihil dicam reconditum, nihil aut inauditum vobis aut cuiquam novum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:31:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 31, 137</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod nobis inauditum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novum est, non dico inusitatum, verum omnino inauditum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:13:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 13, 36</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:14:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 14, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">novum crimen et ante hunc diem inauditum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insignis quaedam, inaudita, nova magnitudo animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:39:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 39, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incredibilis atque inaudita gravitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modus et inauditus et incredibilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:6:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: novellas et inauditas sectas veteribus religionibus opponere, Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 15, 3, 3; cf. § 7.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum nescias invisitatius an inauditius genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. 3:14" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. 3, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22227.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Unheard</hi> (of an accused person), <hi rend="ital">without a hearing</hi> (only post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">inauditus et indefensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 77</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 11</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inauditos et innoxios relegavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 22, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also of the cause or defence of the accused: neque inaudita causa quemquam damnari, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:17:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 17, 1</bibl></cit>.—*</sense><sense id="n22227.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Without hearing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alia (animalia) gignuntur aut inodora inauditave,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:6:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 6, 1</bibl></cit> (al. inauritave).</sense></entryFree>
inauguratio: <entryFree id="n22228" type="main" key="i^naugu^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnaugŭrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>inauguro, a consecration; hence, transf.</etym>, <sense id="n22228.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a beginning</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Valent. 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inaugurato: <entryFree id="n22229" type="main" key="i^naugu^ra_to_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnaugŭrātō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. inauguro, b.</entryFree>
inauguro: <entryFree id="n22230" type="main" key="i^naugu^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-augŭro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n22230.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22230.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> <hi rend="ital">To take omens from the flight of birds</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to practise augury</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to divine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">per sacram viam augures ex arce profecti solent inaugurare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=47" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 47</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cb n="INAU" /> impetritum, inauguratum'st: <cit><quote lang="la">quovis admittunt aves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Palatinum Romulus, Aventinum Remus ad inaugurandum templa capiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agedum, divine tu, inaugura, fierine possit, quod nunc ego mente concipio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:36:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 36, 4</bibl></cit>. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">b. inaugŭrāto</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> (lit. <hi rend="ital">abl. absol.</hi>), <hi rend="ital">after consulting the birds</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id quia inaugurato Romulus fecerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:36:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 36, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consecrare locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:44:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 44, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22230.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n22230.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To give a certain sanctity to</hi> a place or (official) person <hi rend="ital">by ceremony of consulting the flight of birds</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to consecrate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inaugurate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">install</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:20:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 20, 6</bibl></cit>: VRBEM (Romulus) Calend. Praenest. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2, p. 386</bibl>: cur non inaugurare? Sume diem; <cit><quote lang="la">vide, qui te inauguret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:43:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 43, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">augur in locum ejus inauguratus est filius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:26:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 26, 10</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem flaminem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 8, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:28:7" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 28, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n22230.4" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to install</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cena et poculis magnis inauguratur (dux latronum),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 191</bibl></cit>: comitia, quae habentur aut regis aut flaminum inaugurandorum causa, Lab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:27:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 27, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si flamines Diales inaugurentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:130" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 130</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inaurator: <entryFree id="n22231" type="main" key="i^naura_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnaurātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>inauro</etym>, <sense id="n22231.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gilder</hi> (post-class.), Firm. 4, 15; 8, 26; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4201</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 1074, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inauratura: <entryFree id="n22232" type="main" key="i^naura_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnaurātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22232.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gilding</hi>, Front.—<hi rend="ital">Piur.</hi>, Gromat. Vet. 97, 8.</sense></entryFree>
inauratus: <entryFree id="n22233" type="main" key="i^naura_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnaurātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from inauro.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n22234" type="hapax" key="i^naura_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-aurātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22234.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not gilded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not ornamented with gold</hi>: inauratae atque illautae mulieris, Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 181</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
inaures: <entryFree id="n22235" type="main" key="i^naures"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnaures</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>in-auris</etym>, <sense id="n22235.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ear-drops</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ear-rings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ornaments for the ear</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:3:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 3, 3, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 55, 81, § 172</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:16" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 2, 7, § 16</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inaurio: <entryFree id="n22236" type="main" key="i^nauri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnaurĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22236.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to give hearing to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cause to hear</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">surdos (Christus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Epit. 45, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22236.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To grant</hi> (in answer to prayer), Hilar. in Psa. 53, 54.</sense></entryFree>
inauris: <entryFree id="n22237" type="main" key="i^nauris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnauris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, v. inaures.</entryFree>
inauritus: <entryFree id="n22238" type="hapax" key="i^nauri_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-aurītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22238.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">without ears</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animalia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:6:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 6, 1</bibl></cit> dub.; v. 2. inauditus, III.</sense></entryFree>
inauro: <entryFree id="n22239" type="main" key="i^nauro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-auro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n22239.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cover</hi> or <hi rend="ital">overlay with gold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to gild</hi> (class.; most freq. in the <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>). </sense><sense id="n22239.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tegulas aereas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 18, § 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">maurata statua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:21:section=50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 21, § 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">columna extrinsecus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:24:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 24, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romulus (i. e. statua Romuli),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palla,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 47, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>inwrought with gold</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:Fac. 18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. Fac. 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22239.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to gild</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to make rich</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">puto, te malle a Caesare consuli quam inaurari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut te Confestim liquidus fortunae rivus inauret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 9</bibl></cit>.— Hence. <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnaurātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">gilded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">golden</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis radat inaurati femur Herculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:151" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 151</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omni patagio inauratior pavo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 3 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
inauspicato: <entryFree id="n22240" type="main" key="i^nauspi^ca_to_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnauspĭcātō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n22240.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr> art.</sense></entryFree>
inauspicatus: <entryFree id="n22241" type="main" key="i^nauspi^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-auspĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n22241.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">At which no auspices were taken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without auspices</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 6, 11</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n22241.1" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">in-auspĭcāto</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> (lit. <hi rend="ital">abl. absol.</hi>), <hi rend="ital">without consulting the auspices</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod inauspicato pomoerium transgressus esset (Ti. Gracchus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:17:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 17, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22241.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of bad omen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unlucky</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inauspicious</hi> (only post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">inauspicatarum animantium vice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 1, 1, § 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 23, 26, § 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exemplum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 16, 15, § 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">garrulitas (cornicis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 12, 14, § 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bibente conviva mensam tolli inauspicatissimum judicatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 2, 5, § 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22241.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Unhoped for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unexpected</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">successus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ennod.</author> Ep. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inausus: <entryFree id="n22242" type="main" key="i^nausus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ausus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22242.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not ventured</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unattempted</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid inausum Aut intractatum scelerisve dolive fuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 205</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nefas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:807" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 807</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid enim per hosce dies inausum intemeratumve vobis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sciat animus nihil inausum esse fortunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 91" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 91</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">med.—Plur.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ausa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">unattempted things</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deeds beyond daring</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae inausa audeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 20" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inauxiliatus: <entryFree id="n22243" type="main" key="i^nauxi^li^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnauxĭlĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> <etym>2. in - auxilior</etym>, <sense id="n22243.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not supported</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:12:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 12, 16</bibl>. <pb n="917" /> <cb n="INCA" /></sense></entryFree>
inavarus: <entryFree id="n22244" type="main" key="i^na^va_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnăvārus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> <etym>2. in-avarus</etym>, <sense id="n22244.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not greedy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not avaricious</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 1, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inaversibilis: <entryFree id="n22245" type="hapax" key="i^na_versi^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnāversĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-aversus</etym>, <sense id="n22245.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be turned aside</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unalterable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aeternitas (with immobilis and insolubilis),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Trim. p. 100 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit> (al. inaversabilis or inversibilis).</sense></entryFree>
inb: <entryFree id="n22246" type="main" key="inb"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inb-</orth>, v. imb-.</entryFree>
incaeduus: <entryFree id="n22247" type="main" key="incaedu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-caedŭus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">incīdŭus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:9" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 9</bibl>?*!0), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22247.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not cut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">felled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uncut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unhewn</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-class. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">lucus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:435" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 435</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:90" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 90</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">intonsi montes, silvosi, incaedui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. E. 5, 63</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incaelatus: <entryFree id="n22248" type="gloss" key="incaela_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incaelātus</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">a)to/rneutos, a)/glufos,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</entryFree>
incalanto: <entryFree id="n22249" type="gloss" key="inca^lanto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incălanto</orth>, <itype>invocanto</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=114" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 114</bibl> Müll. [in-calo].</entryFree>
incalationes: <entryFree id="n22250" type="gloss" key="inca^la_ti^o_nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incălātĭōnes</orth>, <itype>invocationes</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=107" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 107</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
incalative: <entryFree id="n22251" type="gloss" key="inca^la_ti_ve"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incălātīve</orth>, <itype>vocative</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=114" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 114</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
incalcatus: <entryFree id="n22252" type="hapax" key="incalca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-calcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22252.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">untrodden</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">humus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 16, 110</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incalesco: <entryFree id="n22253" type="main" key="inca^lesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-călesco</orth>, <itype>calŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n22253.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grow warm</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to glow</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n22253.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">incalescente sole,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anni tempore jam incalescente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:4:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum videas ordinem rerum per constituta procedere ... aestas suo tempore incaluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:16:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 16, 3</bibl></cit> Haase (al. incanduit): <cit><quote lang="la">incaluerant vino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:57:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 57, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">incaluit vis illa mali (i. e. veneni),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis nostro curvum te funere vidit? Atram quis lacrimis incaluisse togam?</quote> <trans><tr>to glow with burning tears</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 7, 28.— </sense><sense id="n22253.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to glow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kindle</hi> with passion (esp. love): <cit><quote lang="la">ergo ubi vaticinos concepit mente furores Incaluitque deo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:641" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 641</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vidit et incaluit pelagi deus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:574" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 574</bibl></cit>; 3, 371; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 11, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">acres Incaluere animi (equorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 2, 87</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:4:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 3, 4, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Gracchus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:15:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetitiā incaluisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus incaluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 240</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad magnas cogitationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incalfacio: <entryFree id="n22254" type="main" key="incalfa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-calfăcĭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n22254.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to warm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to heat</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">culmos Titan incalfacit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:919" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 919</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cultros (hostia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:735" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 15, 735</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incallide: <entryFree id="n22255" type="main" key="incalli^de_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incallĭdē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. incallidus <sense id="n22255.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
incallidus: <entryFree id="n22256" type="main" key="incalli^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-callĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22256.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unskilful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incapable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">simple</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stupid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">servus non incallidus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>shrewd</tr>, <tr>knowing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:16:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 16, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non incallidi homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:3:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incallidus alioqui et facilis juventa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: judex formae, <hi rend="ital">incompetent</hi>, Sabin. <bibl default="NO"><author>Her.</author> 3, 55</bibl>; cf.: fuit in jure non incallidus, Capit. Macrin. 13. — <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">incallĭdē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">unskilfully</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in his tribus generibus non incallide tergiversantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:33:118" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 33, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opposuisse hoc Tullianum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:13:19" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 13, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conquirere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7</bibl></cit>. 3, 45.</sense></entryFree>
incallo: <entryFree id="n22257" type="main" key="incallo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incallo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-callum</etym>, <sense id="n22257.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to render callous</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">carnem indurat et incallat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 2, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incandesco: <entryFree id="n22258" type="main" key="incandesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-candesco</orth>, <itype>dŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n22258.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become warm</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to glow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to kindle</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">volat illud (plumbum) et incandescit eundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:728" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 728</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetus accensis incanduit ignibus ara,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spumis incanduit unda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempestas totoque auctumni incanduit aestu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:479" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 479</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars magna terrarum alto pulvere incanduit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:30:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 30, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestas incanduit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:16:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 16, 3</bibl></cit> (dub.; Haase, incaluit).—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">studii mei ardor incanduit,</quote> <trans><tr>was kindled</tr>, <tr>became strong</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 1:90" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 1, 90</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incandido: <entryFree id="n22259" type="main" key="incandi^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-candĭdo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n22259.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make white</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cleanse</hi> (eccl. Lat.): maculas, Firm. de Err. Relig. 28.</sense></entryFree>
incandidus: <entryFree id="n22260" type="gloss" key="incandi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incandĭdus</orth> <foreign lang="greek">a)leu/kantos,</foreign> Gloss. Phil.</entryFree>
incanesco: <entryFree id="n22261" type="main" key="inca_nesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-cānesco</orth>, <itype>canŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n22261.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become white</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to turn gray</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hoary</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">tortaque remigio spumis incanuit unda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornusque incanuit albo Flore piri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gelu magnoque incanuit imbre Caucasus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:611" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 611</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum pigra incanuit aetas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:328" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 328</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incantamentum: <entryFree id="n22262" type="main" key="incanta_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incantāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>incanto</etym>, <sense id="n22262.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a charm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incantation</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">valeantne aliquid verba et incantamenta carminum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 2, 3, § 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anile,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anilia incantamenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 29, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incantatio: <entryFree id="n22263" type="main" key="incanta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incantātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22263.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an enchanting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enchantment</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">magicae, Firm. Math. 5, 5: incantationum vires,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Hab. Mul. 2</bibl></cit>. <cb n="INCA" /></sense></entryFree>
incantator: <entryFree id="n22264" type="main" key="incanta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incantātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>incanto</etym>, <sense id="n22264.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an enchanter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wizard</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Idol. 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 8, 9, 15</bibl>; Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 15, 1, 2.</sense></entryFree>
incanto: <entryFree id="n22265" type="main" key="incanto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-canto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> * <sense id="n22265.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To sing</hi> in, with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">passer incantans saepiculae (i. e. in saepicula),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 210, 26</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n22265.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n22265.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To say over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mutter</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">chant a magic formula</hi> against some one: QVI MALVM CARMEN INCANTASSET, Fragm. XII. Tab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 2, 4, § 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n22265.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n22265.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To consecrate with charms</hi> or <hi rend="ital">spells</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">incantata vincula,</quote> <trans><tr>lovelcnots</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 8, 49</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22265.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To bewitch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enchant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaesisti, quod mihi emolumentum fuerit incantandi (sc. illam)?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 305</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incantata mulier,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pileum vetitis artibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 7, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incanus: <entryFree id="n22266" type="main" key="inca_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-cānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22266.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">quite gray</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hoary</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">homo crispus, incanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:311" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 311</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">barba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:2:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labra Famis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:804" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 804</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 20</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">saecula,</quote> <trans><tr>hoary centuries</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:95:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 95, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incapabilis: <entryFree id="n22267" type="main" key="inca^pa_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incăpābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-capio</etym>, <sense id="n22267.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">incomprehensible</hi> (late Lat.): deus, Arrian. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 174" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 174</bibl>; cf.: incapabilis <foreign lang="greek">a)xw/rhtos,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
incapabilitas: <entryFree id="n22268" type="main" key="inca^pa_bi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incăpābĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>incapabilis</etym>, <sense id="n22268.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">incomprehensibility</hi> (eccl. Lat.): ecce incapabilitatem habet Pater, quae non est tua, Aug. cont. Max. 1, 9, 2.</sense></entryFree>
incapax: <entryFree id="n22269" type="main" key="inca^pax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-căpax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22269.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">incapable</hi> (postclass.): sacramenti, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef.</foreign> 10, 588: <cit><quote lang="la">aedes incapax solvi,</quote> <trans><tr>indissoluble</tr>, <tr>indestructible</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:ib. 348" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 348</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incapistro: <entryFree id="n22270" type="main" key="inca^pistro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-căpistro</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n22270.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to halter</hi> or <hi rend="ital">muzzle;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">to fetter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entangle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem malis erroribus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 266, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incarno: <entryFree id="n22271" type="main" key="incarno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incarno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-caro</etym>, orig., <sense id="n22271.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make flesh;</hi> hence, in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">in-carnārī</orth>, <itype>ātus</itype>, <hi rend="ital">to be made flesh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">become incarnate</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. An. 1, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Salv.</author> adv. Avar. 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 2, 9 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
incassum: <entryFree id="n22272" type="main" key="incassum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incassum</orth>, v. cassus, II.</entryFree>
incassus: <entryFree id="n22273" type="main" key="incassus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-cassus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22273.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">vain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non incassa futura temptamina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Dial. 3, 10, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incaste: <entryFree id="n22274" type="main" key="incaste_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incastē</orth>, v. incestus <sense id="n22274.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
incastigatus: <entryFree id="n22275" type="main" key="incasti_ga_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-castīgātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22275.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unpunished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unreproved</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec me dimittes incastigatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 45</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incastratura: <entryFree id="n22276" type="main" key="incastra_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-castrātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n22276.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tenon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:26:17 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 26, 17 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">36, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incatholicus: <entryFree id="n22277" type="main" key="inca^tho^li^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-căthŏlĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22277.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not catholic;</hi> perh. only as <hi rend="ital">subst. plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">incăthŏ-lĭci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <hi rend="ital">heretics</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab incatholicis catholica laceratur ecclesia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Anim. 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incaute: <entryFree id="n22278" type="main" key="incaute_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incautē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. incautus <sense id="n22278.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
incautela: <entryFree id="n22279" type="main" key="incaute_la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incautēla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>incautus</etym>, <sense id="n22279.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">want of foresight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incautiousness</hi> (late Lat.): per incautelam deperire, Salvian. Gub. D. 6 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></sense></entryFree>
incautus: <entryFree id="n22280" type="main" key="incautus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-cautus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n22280.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incautious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heedless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">improvident</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inconsiderate</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. improvidus): ut in ipsum incautum atque etiam imparatum incideret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:30:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 30, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 7, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Trebonius oppressus est ab hoste incautus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:22:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 22, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">minime incautus patronus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:70:246" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 70, 246</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab secundis rebus incauti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:44:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 44, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad credendum pavor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:12:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 12, 8</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">incautior fuissem, nisi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 24, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juventa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:13:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 13, 14</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">incautissimus quia credulus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 11</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n22280.1" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>, or the <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a fraude,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">futuri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:766" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 766</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n22280.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not guarded against</hi> or <hi rend="ital">that cannot be guarded against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unforeseen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unexpected</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uncertain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dangerous</hi> (not in ante-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">scelus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:390" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 390</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sic est incautum quidquid habetur amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:4:14" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 4, 14</bibl></cit> (v. 24 M.): <cit><quote lang="la">quod neglexeris incautum at que apertum habes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:38:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 38, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter hostibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub ictu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:99" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenebrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:500" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 500</bibl></cit>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">in-cautē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">incautiously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inconsiderately</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adhuc stulte omnia et incaute,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 10</bibl></cit>: atque inconsulte pugnare. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:15:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 15, 9</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod paulo incautius custodias in muro dispositas videbat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 27, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 24, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subit murum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 7, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potes apparatius cenare apud multos: nusquam hilarius, simplicius, incautius,</quote> <trans><tr>more at ease</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 4</bibl></cit>.— <cb n="INCE" /> <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: ut se ipsos incautissime proderent, Aug. de Mor. Manich. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
incavillatio: <entryFree id="n22281" type="gloss" key="inca^villa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incăvillātĭo</orth> <itype>per despectum irrisio</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=107:15" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 107, 15</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
incavillor: <entryFree id="n22282" type="main" key="inca^villor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-căvillor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, <sense id="n22282.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to revile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mock at</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">joco regem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 5</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.</hi></sense></entryFree>
incavo: <entryFree id="n22283" type="hapax" key="inca^vo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-căvo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n22283.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to hollow out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make hollow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:25:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 25, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incedo: <entryFree id="n22284" type="main" key="ince_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-cēdo</orth>, <itype>cessi, cessum</itype> (<sense id="n22284.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sync. perf.</hi> incesti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 6, 11</bibl>), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to go</hi>, <hi rend="ital">step</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">march along</hi> at a measured pace (class.). </sense><sense id="n22284.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n22284.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n22284.3" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenero et molli ingressu suspendimus gradum: non ambulamus, sed incedimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 7:31" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 7, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per vias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 71</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">socios per ipsos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 188</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tota in urbe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:653" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 653</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quacumque incederet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:24:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 24, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam taeter incedebat, quam truculentus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incessit deinde, qua duxit praedae spes, victor exercitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:36:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 36, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiam si pedes incedat, memorabilem fore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:9:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 9, 15</bibl></cit>: servi pedibus, liberi non nisi equis incedunt. i. e. <hi rend="ital">walk ... ride</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:3:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 41, 3, 4</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">incedunt pueri, pariterque ante ora parentum Frenatis lucent in equis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:553" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 553</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a foro domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sessum impransum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. prol. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui huc incedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 3, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 179</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc ad nos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 5, 2, 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">undique nuntii incedunt, qui afferrent, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ovans praeda onustus incederem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix incedo inanis, ne ire posse cum onere existumes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem modo decoratum ovantemque victoria incedentem vidistis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:16:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 16, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 6, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">claro honore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus laetitiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incedunt per ora vestra magnifici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 31:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 31, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego quae divum incedo regina,</quote> <trans><tr>who walk majestic as</tr>, <tr>who am</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 46</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:2:6" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">matrona incedit census induta nepotum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:13:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 13, 11</bibl></cit> (4, 12): <cit><quote lang="la">ut mea Luxuria Nemesis fluat ut que per urbem Incedat donis conspicienda meis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:3:52" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 3, 52</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22284.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">incedunt maestos locos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scaenam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fontem aquae nando,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 22</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22284.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic., in milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">to move forwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">march</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">barbari in perculsos Romanos acrius incedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 101:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 101, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in erumpentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohortes paulatim incedere jubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 60:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 60, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munito agmine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 46:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 46, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmen reliquum incedere coepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:33:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 33, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">segnius Hispanorum signa incedebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:14:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 14, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sabini usque ad portas urbis populantes incessere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:63:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 63, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propius incedentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod gnarum duci incessitque itineri et proelio paratus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 51</bibl></cit> (Ritter, but Halm omits paratus).—</sense><sense id="n22284.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n22284.7" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">malitiae lenonis contra incedam,</quote> <trans><tr>will encounter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 3, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facilius ad inventionem animus incedet si, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>will proceed to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:14:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 14, 45</bibl></cit> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> — </sense><sense id="n22284.8" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n22284.9" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To triumph over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exult over;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">meo nunc superbus incedis malo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:15:18" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 15, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille superbus incedet victis rivalibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:126" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 126</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22284.10" n="2" level="3"> Of inanim. and abstr. subjects, <hi rend="ital">to come to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">happen to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">befall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seize</hi> one; <hi rend="ital">to approach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occur</hi> (perh. not in Cic.); constr. with <case>dat.</case>, <case>acc.</case>, <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>acc.</case>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22284.11" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>dat.</case> (so most freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">exercitui omni tantus incessit ex incommodo dolor, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:74:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 74, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnus omnium incessit timor animis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 29, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulieres, quibus belli timor insolitus incesserat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 31:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 31, 3</bibl></cit> Kritz <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravior cura patribus incessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:57:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 57, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incedebat enim deterrimo cuique licentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupido incessit animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:11:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 11, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:1:16" default="NO">3, 1, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si sterilitas annorum incessit hominibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 10, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:8:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 8, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n22284.12" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsum ingens cupido incesserat Tarenti potiundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 13, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timor patres incessit, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 17, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:32:1" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 32, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">7, 39, 4 et saep.: indignatio hostes incessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversa valetudo aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingens animos desperatio incessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:2:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 2, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:8:25" default="NO">3, 8, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stupor omnes et admiratio incessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:6:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 22, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: cupido incessit aliquem (with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Chron. 1, 38, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 16, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n22284.13" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis morbi, pestilentia incedit in castra, in Poenos Romanosque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: pestilentia incesserat pari clade in Romanos<pb n="918" /> <cb n="INCE" />  Poenosque, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:46:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 46, 15</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n22284.14" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nova nunc religio unde istaec incessit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantus eo facto timor incessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 101</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Auct. B. Alex. 7: postquam tenebrae incedebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 37</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi crepusculum incesserit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:18" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi tempestas incessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:52:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 52, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">siccitates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:9:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 9, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lascivia atque superbia incessere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 41:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 41, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi Romam legati venere, tanta commutatio incessit, uti, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">religio deinde incessit, vitio eos creatos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 17, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi pro modestia ac pudore ambitio et vis incedebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud invito imperatore ea fieri occultus rumor incedebat,</quote> <trans><tr>went abroad</tr>, <tr>spread about</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 55</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
incelatus: <entryFree id="n22285" type="gloss" key="ince_la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incēlātus</orth> <foreign lang="greek">a)/kruptos,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</entryFree>
inceleber: <entryFree id="n22286" type="main" key="ince^le^ber"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-cĕlĕber</orth>, <itype>bris, bre</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22286.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not celebrated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not known to fame</hi> (post - Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">vallis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:379" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 379</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">advocatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:22:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 22, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:14:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 14, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incelebratus: <entryFree id="n22287" type="main" key="ince^lebra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-cĕlebrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22287.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not made known</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not spread abroad</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ab aliis incelebrata (opp. digna cognitu),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa per invidiam scriptorum incelebrata sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. Fragm. 1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. Fragm. 1, 57</bibl></cit> Kritz (dub.; Dietsch reads celata).</sense></entryFree>
incenatus: <entryFree id="n22288" type="main" key="ince_na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-cēnātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">in-coen-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-cenatus</etym>, <sense id="n22288.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that has not dined</hi> or <hi rend="ital">eaten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dinnerless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hungry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fasting</hi> (ante- and postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">bibat aquam mulsam, cubet incenatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 156, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superi incenati sunt, et cenati inferi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 4, 2, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">incenis: pridie incenato dare medicamenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 140" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 140</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incendefacio: <entryFree id="n22289" type="hapax" key="incende^fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incendĕfăcĭo</orth>, <itype>fēci, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>incendo-facio</etym>, <sense id="n22289.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to set on fire</hi>: carraginem, Treb. <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incendialis: <entryFree id="n22290" type="hapax" key="incendi^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incendĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>incendium</etym>, <sense id="n22290.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to fires</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fire-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunica,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Nat. 1, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incendiarius: <entryFree id="n22291" type="main" key="incendi^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incendĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22291.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">causing a conflagration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">setting on fire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fire-.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22291.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">avis,</quote> <trans><tr>fire-bird</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 13, 17, § 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 4, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 11</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n22291.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">incendĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an incendiary</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">incendiarii, qui consulto incendium inferunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 3, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incendiosus: <entryFree id="n22292" type="main" key="incendi^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incendĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22292.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">burning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hot</hi> (post - class.): <cit><quote lang="la">folia gustu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solis fervor incendiosior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 1, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incendium: <entryFree id="n22293" type="main" key="incendi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incendĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>incendo</etym>, <sense id="n22293.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a burning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conflagration.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22293.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (freq. and class.; equally common in <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number>): <cit><quote lang="la">incendium facere,</quote> <trans><tr>to set fire to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:4:2:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 4, 2, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">excitare, restinguere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:25:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 25, 51</bibl></cit> (v. under II.): <cit><quote lang="la">in ipso urbis incendio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentum flumine atque incendio corruperunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:55:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 55, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia incendiis vastare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:25:1" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 25, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil cogitant nisi caedes, nisi incendia, nisi rapinas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si incendium in arce fuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:7:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si janua tenebitur incendio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:13:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 13, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cunctos qui proelio superfuerant, incendium hausit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 60 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neglecta solent incendia sumere vires,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 85</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:680" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 680</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aetna nocturnis mirus incendiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivendum est illic, ubi nulla incendia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:197" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 197</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incendia praedandi causa facere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 20, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuita incendia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 20, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22293.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n22293.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">fire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heat</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">siderum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 68, 68, § 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Auster Africae incendia cum serenitate affert,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:329" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 33, 76, § 329</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stomachi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:872" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 872</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22293.4" n="2" level="3"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">a firebrand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">torch</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:539" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 539</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n22293.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">fire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vehemence</hi> (class.; a favorite trope of Cic.). </sense><sense id="n22293.6" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">si quod esset in suas fortunas incendium excitatum, id se non aquā sed ruinā restincturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:25:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 25, 51 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">miseriarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:32:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 32, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidiae incendio conflagrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:11:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 11, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incendio alieni judicii conflagrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: res cogit, huic tanto incendio succurrere omnes, qui, etc., Asin. Poll. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:33:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 33, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">populare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:40:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 40, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annonae,</quote> <trans><tr>a raising of the price of corn</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 4, 168</bibl></cit>; Ps.-<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 12:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 12, 4</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n22293.7" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">the fire of passion</hi>: ita mihi in pectore atque in corde facit amor incendium, Plaut. Merc. <cb n="INCE" /> 3, 4, 3: <cit><quote lang="la">cupiditatum incendiis inflammatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:24:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 24, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">restinctis jam animorum incendiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:8:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 8, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratione concitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:47:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 47, 197</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abstruso pectus ejus flagravit incendio (i. e. dolore),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:130:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 130, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militaris tumultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:125:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 125, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliae Satyris incendia mitia praebent,</quote> <trans><tr>enkindle</tr>, <tr>inflame</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:411" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 411</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">movere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:301" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 301</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incendo: <entryFree id="n22294" type="main" key="incendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incendo</orth>, <itype>di, sum, 3</itype> (archaic form of the <sense id="n22294.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf. subj.</hi> incensit = incenderit, sicut incepsit = inceperit, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=107" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 107</bibl> Müll.), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-candeo; cf.: accendo and succendo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to set fire to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to kindle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burn</hi> (freq. and class.; syn. inflammare). </sense><sense id="n22294.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupas taedā ac pice refertas incendunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tus et odores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:37:section=77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 37, § 77</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">odores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:18:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 18, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lychnos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:727" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 727</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppida sua omnia, vicos, reliqua privata aedificia incendunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedificia vicosque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabularium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:30:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N.
