D. 3, 30, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Capitolium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 47:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 47, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamquam ipse suas incenderit aedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:222" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 222</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classem inflammari incendique jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:Verr. 2:5:35:section=91" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 35, § 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:Cat. 3:4:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 4, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 9, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod primo incendendum Avaricum censuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vepres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 271</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ipse circumsessus paene incenderere,</quote> <trans><tr>wast consumed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:33:section=85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 33, § 85</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec incendit nisi ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 28</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22294.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n22294.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To light up with fire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make a fire upon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aras votis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in pursuance of vows</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:279" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 279</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altaria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 285</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22294.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To heat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make hot</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">igne et tenuibus lignis fornacem incendemus,</quote> <trans><tr>will heat</tr>, <tr>warm</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:19:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 19, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22294.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To make bright</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to brighten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">illumine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejusdem (solis) incensa radiis luna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:31:87" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 31, 87</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:1:41" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 1, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">maculosus et auro Squamam incendebat fulgor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 88</bibl></cit>: vivis digitos incendere gemmis, <hi rend="ital">to make brilliant</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to adorn</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:1:134" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 1, 134</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n22294.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n22294.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To kindle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inflame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set on fire; to fire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rouse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excite; to irritate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incense</hi> (esp. freq. in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">ut mihi non solum tu incendere judicem, sed ipse ardere videaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:45:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 45, 188</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iidem hominem perustum etiamnum gloria volunt incendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me ita vel cepit vel incendit, ut cuperem, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem morando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 25:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 25, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(aliquem) querelis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:360" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 360</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in minime gratum spectaculum animo incenduntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 25, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tyndariden incendit amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:207" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 207</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebem largiundo atque pollicitando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 38:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 38, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juventutem ad facinora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonorum animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum cupidum inopiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupiditatem alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 21, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odia improborum in nos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum pudor incendit vires et conscia virtus,</quote> <trans><tr>inflames</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:455" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 455</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illam incendentem luctus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 500</bibl></cit>: clamore incendunt caelum, <hi rend="ital">set on fire with</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">fill with</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 895</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">regiam repentino luctu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 38, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rabie jecur incendente feruntur Praecipites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:648" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 648</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus incendi jam frigidus, aevo Laomedontiades possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:325" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 325</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimis sermone hujus irā incendor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 4, 14</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">incendor irā, esse ausam facere haec te injussu meo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 1, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hisce ego illam dictis ita tibi incensam dabo, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 7, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amore sum incensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:5:section=18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 5, § 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(mulier) incensa odio pristino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:64:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 64, 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incendor quotidie magis non desiderio solum sed etiam incredibili fama virtutum admirabilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:10:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 10, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incensus studio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:17:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 17, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iratus iste vehementer Sthenio et incensus hospitium renuntiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:36:section=89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 36, § 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes incenduntur ad studia gloriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 19, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperator incensus ad rem publicam bene gerendam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:14:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 14, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar ab eo (Crasso) in me esset incensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla mens est tam ad comprehendendam vim oratoris parata, quae possit incendi, nisi inflammatus ipse ad eam et ardens accesseris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:45:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 45, 190 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inimicitiis incensa contentio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:Or. 7:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Opt. Gen. Or. 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incensus calcaribus equus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:48:5" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 48, 5</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: loquarne? incendam; <cit><quote lang="la">taceam? instigem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dumque petit petitur pariterque incendit et ardet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:425" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 425</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n22294.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To enhance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">raise</hi>: annonam <cb n="INCE" /> (<hi rend="ital">the price of corn</hi>), <hi rend="ital">to produce a dearness</hi> or <hi rend="ital">scarcity</hi> (shortly before: <cit><quote lang="la">excandefaciebant),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:2:16" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 2, 16</bibl></cit> (cf. incendium, II. A.).— </sense><sense id="n22294.9" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To destroy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lay waste</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si istuc conare ... tuum incendes genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">campos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:631" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 631</bibl></cit>. — Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">incensus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">inflamed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hot</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">profuit incensos aestus avertere ( = vehementissimos ardores febris),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:469" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 469</bibl></cit> Forbig. ad loc.— In <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aether,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 3, 201</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incenis: <entryFree id="n22295" type="main" key="ince_nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-cēnis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">in-coen-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-cenatus</etym>, <sense id="n22295.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that has not dined</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dinnerless</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">senex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 1, 18</bibl></cit> (cf. incenatus, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 2, 9</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
inceno: <entryFree id="n22296" type="main" key="ince_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-cēno</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">in-coen-</orth>), <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n22296.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to dine there</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to dine in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">at a place</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">incenante eo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:39" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 39</bibl></cit> dub. (al. cenante eo).</sense></entryFree>
incense: <entryFree id="n22297" type="spur" key="incense_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incensē</orth>, false read. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:3:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 3, 13</bibl>, instead of impense; v. impendo <sense id="n22297.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
incensio: <entryFree id="n22298" type="main" key="incensio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incensio</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>incendo</etym>, <sense id="n22298.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a setting on fire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burning</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">Capitolii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incensione urbem liberavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:11:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 11, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 234</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incensitus: <entryFree id="n22299" type="main" key="incensi^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incensĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-censeo</etym>, <sense id="n22299.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not assessed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not enrolled in the census</hi>, Cod. Th. 10, 23, 1.</sense></entryFree>
incensor: <entryFree id="n22300" type="main" key="incensor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incensor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>incendo</etym>, <sense id="n22300.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who kindles</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sets fire to</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n22300.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">messium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:19:16:section=9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 19, 16, § 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 20</bibl>; Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 12, 3, 2: specularum, i. e. <hi rend="ital">who kindles beacons</hi>, App. de Mundo, p. 69. — </sense><sense id="n22300.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an inciter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instigator</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 9, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incensum: <entryFree id="n22301" type="main" key="incensum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incensum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n22301.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A setting fire to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lighting</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">hora incensi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> de Virg. 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22301.1" n="II" level="1"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">incense</hi>: incenso imposito, Inscr. Fratr. Arv. ap. Marin. p. 639; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Chron. 1, 47, 4</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 4, 12</bibl>: incensum <foreign lang="greek">qumi/ama,</foreign> Gloss. Phil. — </sense><sense id="n22301.2" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">sacrifice</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">incensum abominatio est mihi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Jud. 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:18:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 18, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ecclus. 45, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incensus: <entryFree id="n22302" type="main" key="incensus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incensus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from incendo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n22303" type="main" key="incensus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incensus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-census</etym>, <sense id="n22303.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not estimated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not assessed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unregistered</hi>; <cit><quote lang="la">said of one who has not given in an account of himself and his property to the censor: hominem incensum vendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:34:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 34, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex de incensis lata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:44:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 44, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Fragm. 11, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incentio: <entryFree id="n22304" type="main" key="incenti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incentĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>incino</etym>. <sense id="n22304.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A blowing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">playing</hi> upon an instrument (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">incentiones tibiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:13:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 13, 3</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n22304.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A charm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enchantment; plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:11:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 11, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incentivus: <entryFree id="n22305" type="main" key="incenti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incentīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22305.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that strikes up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sets the tune</hi> (ante- and post-class.). </sense><sense id="n22305.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: tibia, <hi rend="ital">the treble flute</hi> (opp. succentive, that plays the accompaniment), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:15" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n22305.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">superior</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita pastorum (opp. succentiva vita agricolarum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:16" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 16</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22305.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">that provokes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">incites</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lues,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Hamart. 250</bibl></cit>. —Hence, </sense><sense id="n22305.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">incentīvum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an incentive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">peccaminis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 929</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitiorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 52, 3</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">incen-tīvē</orth>, Ven. Fort. Vit. Leob. 10.</sense></entryFree>
incentor: <entryFree id="n22306" type="main" key="incentor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incentor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22306.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who sets the tune</hi> or <hi rend="ital">begins to sing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a precentor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">singer</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n22306.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">carminis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 15, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incentore canam Phoebo Musisque magistris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Perieg. 895</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 6, 9, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n22306.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an inciter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exciter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">igneus turbarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civilis belli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Oros.</author> 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rebellionis totius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inceps: <entryFree id="n22307" type="gloss" key="inceps"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inceps</orth>, <itype>deinceps</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=107" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 107</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
inceptio: <entryFree id="n22308" type="main" key="incepti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inceptĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>incipio</etym>, <sense id="n22308.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a beginning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undertaking</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tam praeclari operis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 38, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrociniorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 317, 5</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> (opp. depositio), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:46" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 46</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n22308.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">enterprise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undertaking</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inceptio est amentium, non amantium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 3, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incepto: <entryFree id="n22309" type="main" key="incepto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incepto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22309.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to begin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undertake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attempt</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">inceptas facinus facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 23</bibl></cit>; so, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:11:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo iter inceptas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid inceptas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 8, 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22309.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to begin business</hi>, cum aliquo, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to quarrel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si cum illo inceptas homine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 3, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inceptor: <entryFree id="n22310" type="main" key="inceptor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inceptor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22310.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a beginner</hi> (anteand post - class.): o mearum voluptatum <pb n="919" /> <cb n="INCE" /> omnium inventor, inceptor, perfector! <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 8, 4</bibl>: carminis, Avien. Arat. <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
inceptum: <entryFree id="n22311" type="main" key="inceptum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inceptum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. incipio <sense id="n22311.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
inceptus: <entryFree id="n22312" type="main" key="inceptus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inceptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from incipio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n22313" type="main" key="inceptus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inceptus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>incipio</etym>, <sense id="n22313.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a beginning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undertaking</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">foedum inceptu, foedum exitu, Liv. praef. 10: magno in omnia inceptu veneram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 108:15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 108, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eriles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:124" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 124</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incerniculum: <entryFree id="n22314" type="main" key="incerni^cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incernĭcŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>incerno</etym>, <sense id="n22314.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sieve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">searce</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 13, 1</bibl>; Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 88, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n22314.1" n="II" level="1"> As a lit. transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">thli/a,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">a square stand on which the Greek flourdealers set out flour</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">for sale</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 44, 69, § 175</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incerno: <entryFree id="n22315" type="main" key="incerno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-cerno</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n22315.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sift upon</hi> a thing, <hi rend="ital">to cover</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bestrew with sifting; to sift</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scatter with a sieve</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terram cribro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 48, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 6, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">super fricaturam incernatur marmor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incretum ( = per incerniculum sive cribrum inspersum),</quote> <trans><tr>sifted in</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 75</bibl></cit> Orell. (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 6, 23, § 87</bibl>, the correct read. is redimitum; v. Sillig. ad h. l.).</sense></entryFree>
incero: <entryFree id="n22316" type="main" key="ince_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-cēro</orth>, no <sense id="n22316.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>incero</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to smear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cover over with wax</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">canaliculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:8:section=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 8, § 1</bibl></cit>. — <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: genua deorum, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to smear the knees of the gods</hi> by constant embraces and kisses; <hi rend="ital">to be persistent in prayers</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:55" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 55</bibl> (cf. Prud. cont. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:203" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> 1, 203</bibl>; others explain, <hi rend="ital">to attach waxen tablets</hi>, <hi rend="ital">containing written prayers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to the knees of the statues of gods;</hi> cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tacitas preces in templo deis allegasti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 54, p. 309</bibl></cit>); so, <cit><quote lang="la">genua Dianae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 457</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapides (religio),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ham. 404</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incerte: <entryFree id="n22317" type="main" key="incerte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incertē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. incertus <sense id="n22317.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
incerto: <entryFree id="n22318" type="main" key="incerto1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incerto</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. incertus <sense id="n22318.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n22319" type="main" key="incerto2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incerto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>incertus</etym>, <sense id="n22319.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to render doubtful</hi> or <hi rend="ital">uncertain</hi> (ante- and postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">longa dies meum incertat animum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 4, 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prospectum (cursus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 265</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">singultu lacrimoso sermonem incertans,</quote> <trans><tr>making indistinct</tr>, <tr>inaudible</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5</bibl></cit>, p. 164: me incertat dictio, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 123, 30</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 79 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
incertum: <entryFree id="n22320" type="main" key="incertum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incertum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. incertus, II. 2.</entryFree>
incertus: <entryFree id="n22321" type="main" key="incertus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incertus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (archaic <sense id="n22321.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> incertūm, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 495, 27</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. incertus; hence, acc. to certus</etym>. </sense><sense id="n22321.1" n="I" level="1"> Object., of things whose (external or internal) qualities are not firmly established, <hi rend="ital">uncertain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unsettled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">doubtful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">untrustworthy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not fast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not firm</hi> (class.): amicus certus in re incerta cernitur, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:17:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 17, 64</bibl> (Trag. v. 428 Vahl.); cf. id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 166, 22</bibl> (Trag. v. 12 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">incerti socii an hostes essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:35:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 35, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incertus (infans) masculus an femina esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 12, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 49:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 49, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum incerta bellum an pax cum Celtiberis essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:19:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 19, 8</bibl></cit> Weissenb.: spe incerta certum mihi laborem sustuli, Ter. Hec. prol. alt. 9; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:And. 2:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 2, 3, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuptiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:ib. 5:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetas (puerilis) maxime lubrica atque incerta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:52:section=137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 52, § 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itinera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 37 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dominatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">status,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambiguae testis incertaeque rei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:81" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comarum Anulus incertā non bene fixus acu,</quote> <trans><tr>not fast</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:66:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 66, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colligere incertos et in ordine ponere crines,</quote> <trans><tr>dishevelled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per incertam lunam sub luce maligna,</quote> <trans><tr>not clearly visible</tr>, <tr>dim</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:270" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 270</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">soles,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 203</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">securis,</quote> <trans><tr>that did not strike with a sure blow</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 224</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus,</quote> <trans><tr>disturbed</tr>, <tr>uneasy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 106:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 106, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille vitam suam ad incertissimam spem reservavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:22:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 22, 50</bibl></cit>: arbori incertae nullam prudentia cani Rectoris cum ferret opem, <hi rend="ital">the ship uncertain in her course</hi>, because no longer obeying the helm, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:32" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 32</bibl> Halm. — In <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> ellipt.: <cit><quote lang="la">clauserant portas incertum vi an voluntate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:41:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 41, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:43:7 al" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 43, 7 al.</bibl> — <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> as <pos>adv.</pos> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">incertum vigilans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 10, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:212" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 212</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n22321.2" n="II" level="1"> Subject., as respects one's perceptions or convictions, <hi rend="ital">not firmly established</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uncertain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undetermined</hi>, <hi rend="ital">doubtful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dubious</hi> (so most freq. in prose and poetry): <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est incertius vulgo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:17:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 17, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">casus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:28:98" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 28, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut alia certa, alia incerta esse dicunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: est igitur ridiculum, quod est dubium, id relinquere incertum, id. Mur. <cb n="INCE" /> 32, 68; and: <cit><quote lang="la">incerta atque dubia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 1, 1, § 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut incertis temporibus diversisque itineribus iretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">eventus reliqui temporis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 26, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exitus pugnarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:21:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 21, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulterium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:52" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 11, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus ora puellares faciunt incerta capilli,</quote> <trans><tr>make the sex doubtful</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:137" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incerta persona heres institui non potest,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Fragm. 22, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:242" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 242</bibl>; cf. 2, 238.—</sense><sense id="n22321.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">rel.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">interrog.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc mihi incertumst, abeam an maneam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 9, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moriendum certe est, et id incertum, an hoc ipso die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:20:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 20, 74</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Gallus) avem, an gentem, an nomen, an fortunam corporis significet, incertum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:9:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">confessus est quidem sed incertum, utrum quia verum erat, an quia, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 11, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque plane occultati humilitate arborum et tamen incerti, quidnam esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 49:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 49, 5</bibl></cit> Kritz.—<hi rend="ital">Abl. absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multi annantes navibus incerto prae tenebris, quid aut peterent aut vitarent, foede interierunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:36:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 36, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22321.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">incer-tum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an uncertainty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid incerti mihi in animo prius aut ambiguum fuit, Nunc liquet, nunc defaecatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne cujus incerti vanique auctor esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:13:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 13, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incerta maris et tempestatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incerta fortunae experiri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 19, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incerta belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona, fortunae possessionesque omnium in dubium incertumque revocabuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:27:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 27, 76</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Minucius praefectus annonae in incertum creatus,</quote> <trans><tr>for an indefinite time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 13, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postremo fugere an manere tutius foret, in incerto erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 38:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 38, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Allobroges diu in incerto habuere, quidnam consilii caperent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 41:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 41, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 46:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 46, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperia ducum in incerto reliquerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n22321.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of a person who is in a state of uncertainty respecting any thing, <hi rend="ital">uncertain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in uncertainty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hesitating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">doubtful</hi>: quo ego ope mea Pro incertis certos compotesque consili Dimitto, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:45:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 45, 199</bibl> (Trag. v. 188 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">nolo suspensam et incertam plebem Romanam obscura spe et caeca exspectatione pendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:25:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 25, 66</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">varius incertusque agitabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 74:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 74, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego certe me incerto scio hoc daturum nemini homini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 4, 60</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22321.6" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid dicam hisce, incertus sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 4, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum incertus essem, ubi esses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incerti ignarique, quid potissimum facerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 67:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 67, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incerti quidnam esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 49:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 49, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incertus, quonam modo aciem instrueret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 101:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 101, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incerti, quo fata ferant, ubi sistere detur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incertus, Geniumne loci famulumne parentis Esse putet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faber, incertus scamnum faceretne Priapum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 8, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22321.7" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> (not in Cic.): summarum rerum incerti, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:45:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 45, 199</bibl> (Trag. v. 187 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">incertusque meae paene salutis eram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:3:4" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:57:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 57, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 23, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:27:6" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 27, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:24:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 24, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:525" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 525</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves incertae locorum, Auct. B. Afr. 7: mox incertus animi, fesso corpore, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 55 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">futurorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:13:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 13, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:10:27" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 10, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22321.8" n="(d)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">incerti metu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:602" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 602</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">de</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">incertus de salute alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:20:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 20, 10</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos> in two forms: <orth extent="full" lang="la">incertē</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">incerto</orth> (both ante-class.), <hi rend="ital">uncertainly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not certainly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dubiously</hi>: incerte errat animus, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:10:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 10, 12</bibl> (Trag. v. 259 Vahl.): vagat exsul, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 467, 25</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 87 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">ubi Habitet dum incerto scio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incerto scio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incerto autumo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 4, 1, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incessabilis: <entryFree id="n22322" type="main" key="incessa_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incessābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-cesso</etym>, <sense id="n22322.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unceasing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incessant</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">labor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:6" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 6</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">in-cessābĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">incessantly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, 303</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 64</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incessans: <entryFree id="n22323" type="main" key="incessans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incessans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-cessans</etym>, <sense id="n22323.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">incessant</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">virtus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Complex. Act. Apost. 11</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">incessan-ter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">incessantly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inhaerere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 11, 42, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legebat auctores antiquos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 11 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
incesso: <entryFree id="n22324" type="main" key="incesso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incesso</orth>, <itype>cessīvi</itype> (less freq. cessi. Tac <cb n="INCE" /> H. 2, 23; 3, 77; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:680" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 680</bibl>), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>incedo</etym>, <sense id="n22324.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fall upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assault</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attack</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n22324.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (pars corporis) cum jaculis saxisque incesseretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:24:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 24, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vagos suos pro hostibus lapidibus incessebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 10, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">infestis digitis ora et oculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">feras argenteis vasis incessivere tum primum noxii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 16, § 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telorum lapidumque jactu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:566" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 566</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a pueris ii more quodam gentis saxis globosis, funda mare apertum incessentes exercebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:29:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 29, 4</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">jaculis et voce superba Tecta incessentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:361" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 361</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:473" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 473</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">saevis telis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:402" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 402</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stercore et caeno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 17</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n22324.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to attack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assault</hi>, esp. with words, <hi rend="ital">to reprove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reproach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accuse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">reges dictis protervis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:232" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 232</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem verbis amaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:209" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 209</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:11:31" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 11, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem conviciis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversarios maledictis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatum diris exsecrationibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sallustium noto epigrammate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenes objurgatione justa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:2:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen hominis acerba cavillatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:57 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 57 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:4:76" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 4, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem poenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:245" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 1, 245</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem criminibus,</quote> <trans><tr>to accuse him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem occultis suspicionibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ut tumidiorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ut impium erga parentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Rhet. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen ut argumentum morum incessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 31</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem tamquam superbe saeveque egisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermonem cum risu aliquos incessentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si aut nationes totae aut ordines incessantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 3, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paucitatem, conspirationem, vilitatem, gratiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne incesse moras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:390" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 390</bibl></cit>.—Of a disease: <cit><quote lang="la">pestilentia incesserat pari clade in Romanos Poenosque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:46:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 46, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta incesserit in ea castra vis morbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 10, 3</bibl></cit>.—Of fear, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">timor deinde patres incessit, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 17, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super haec timor incessit Sabini belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:27:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 27, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantus terror Tarquinium incessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 7, 1</bibl></cit>.—Of other feelings: <cit><quote lang="la">cupido incessit animos juvenum, sciscitandi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:56:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 56, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta admiratio miseratioque viri incessit homines, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 8, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cura incesserat patres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:50:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 50, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incessit omnes stupor et admiratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:6:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 22, 6, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incessus: <entryFree id="n22325" type="main" key="incessus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incessus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>incedo</etym>, <sense id="n22325.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a going</hi>, <hi rend="ital">walking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gait.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22325.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n22325.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">status, incessus, sessio, accubitio, vultus, oculi, manuum motus teneant illud decorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:35:128" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 35, 128</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:18:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 18, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">citus modo, modo tardus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 15:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 15, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fractus,</quote> <trans><tr>effeminate</tr>, <tr>unmanly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:9:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 9, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in incessu mollior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:306" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 306</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incessus Seplasia dignus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:11:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 11, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus animalibus certus et uniusmodi incessus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 38, 54, § 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vera incessu patuit dea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:405" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 405</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incessum fingere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:24:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 24, 77</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:20:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 20, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui vultu morbum incessuque fatetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:17" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot hominum jumentorumque incessu dilapsa est (nix),</quote> <trans><tr>the tread</tr>, <tr>trampling</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:36:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 36, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulvis velut ingentis agminis incessu motus apparuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:41:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 41, 5</bibl></cit>.—Of a threatening approach (cf. B. infra): <cit><quote lang="la">sacerdotes eorum facibus ardentibus anguibusque praelatis incessu furiali militem Romanum insueta turbaverunt specie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 17, 3</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:636" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 636</bibl> — </sense><sense id="n22325.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. (acc. to incedo, I. B.), <hi rend="ital">a hostile irruption</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invasion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attack</hi> (very rare, except in Tacitus): <cit><quote lang="la">Parthorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primo incessu solvit obsidium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 24</bibl></cit>; 2, 55; 3, 74. — * </sense><sense id="n22325.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, concr., <hi rend="ital">an entrance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">approach</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">incessus hostis claudere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inceste: <entryFree id="n22326" type="main" key="inceste_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incestē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. incestus <sense id="n22326.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
incestificus: <entryFree id="n22327" type="hapax" key="incesti^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incestĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>incestusfacio</etym>, <sense id="n22327.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that defiles himself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that commits a bad action</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nefandus, incestificus, exsecrabilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Phoen. 223" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Phoen. 223</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incesto: <entryFree id="n22328" type="main" key="incesto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incesto</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>incestus</etym>, <sense id="n22328.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pollute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defile</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n22328.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">totamque incestat funere classem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:5:4" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem (Furiae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:120" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 11, 120</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Cons. Mall. Theod. 267</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n22328.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to dishonor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defile</hi> with lust: <cit><quote lang="la">puellam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">thalamos novercae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:389" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 389</bibl></cit>. <pb n="920" /> <cb n="INCI" /></sense></entryFree>
incestum: <entryFree id="n22329" type="main" key="incestum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incestum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. 1. incestus, II. B.</entryFree>
incestuosus: <entryFree id="n22330" type="main" key="incestu^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incestŭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. incestus</etym>, <sense id="n22330.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">incestuous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lewd</hi>, Hilar. in Psa. 130, 3.</sense></entryFree>
incestus: <entryFree id="n22331" type="main" key="incestus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incestus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-castus</etym>, <sense id="n22331.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unclean</hi> (in a moral and religious sense), <hi rend="ital">impure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">polluted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defiled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sinful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">criminal</hi> (as an <pos>adj.</pos> mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n22331.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum verborum contumeliis optimum virum incesto ore lacerasset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe Diespiter Neglectus incesto addidit integrum,</quote> <trans><tr>punished the good with the bad</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">catervae Incestarum avium,</quote> <trans><tr>that feed on corpses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:27" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">profana illic omnia, quae apud nos sacra: rursum concessa apud illos, quae apud nos incesta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an triste bidental Moverit incestus,</quote> <trans><tr>impious</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:472" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 472</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n22331.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">unchaste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lewd</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incestuous.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22331.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ilion Fatalis incestusque judex ... vertit In pulverem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Paris</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 19</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also: praedo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,003:1:45" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Ach. 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">princeps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:52:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 52, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 6, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuptiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 25</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">conjugia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:63:7" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 63, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:503" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 503</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pellicere aliquem incesto sermone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:28:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 28, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incestus manus intra terminos sacratos inferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corruptor et idem incestus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:9" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 9</bibl></cit>. — Hence, </sense><sense id="n22331.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22331.5" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">incestum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">unchastity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lewdness;</hi> esp. as a violation of religious laws, <hi rend="ital">incest</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">incestum pontifices supremo supplicio sanciunto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:9:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concubuit cum viro ... fecit igitur incestum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:40:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 40, 73</bibl></cit>. committere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:88" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:2:39" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 23, 2, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex incesto, quod Augustus cum Julia filia admisisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 23</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">incesti cum sorore reus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum filia commissum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incesto liberatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:39:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 39, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incesti damnata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:8:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab incesto id ei loco nomen factum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:15:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 15, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incesti poena ... in viro in insulam deportatio est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 2, 26, 15</bibl></cit>. — In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">stupra ... et adulteria, incesta denique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:35:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 35, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super sororum incesta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:36" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vestalium virginum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22331.6" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">incesta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an incestuous woman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">paramour</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc (adamanta) dedit olim barbarus incestae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:158" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 158</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">incestē</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">incastē</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 2:13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 2, 13</bibl>). </sense><sense id="n22331.7" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">impurely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sinfully</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 98</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere sacrificium Dianae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:45:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 45, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22331.8" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">unchastely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ideo aquam adduxi, ut ea tu inceste uterere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:14:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 14, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libidinatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:28" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agit incestius res suas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 170</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n22332" type="main" key="incestus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incestus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. incestus, II.</etym>, <sense id="n22332.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unchastity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incest</hi> (mostly Ciceron.): <cit><quote lang="la">quaestio de incestu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:22:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 22, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:32:122" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 32, 122</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">124</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:30:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 30, 74</bibl> Klotz; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 44</bibl> Weissenb.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:3:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 3, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incharaxo: <entryFree id="n22333" type="main" key="incha^raxo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-chăraxo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n22333.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to scratch into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to open by scratching</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">avem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:6:5:section=228" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 6, 5, § 228</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inchoo: <entryFree id="n22334" type="main" key="incho^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inchŏo</orth>, v. incoho.</entryFree>
incibo: <entryFree id="n22335" type="main" key="inci^bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-cĭbo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n22335.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to provide with food</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to feed</hi> (late Lat.), Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:231" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 231</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incicur: <entryFree id="n22336" type="hapax" key="inci^cur"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incĭcur</orth>, <itype>ŏris</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-cicur</etym>, <sense id="n22336.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not tame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wild</hi>: incicorem immansuetum et ferum. Pacuvius: reprime incicorem iracundiam, Paul. ex Fest. s. h. v. p. 108 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
incido: <entryFree id="n22337" type="main" key="inci^do1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incĭdo</orth>, <itype>cĭdi, cāsum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n22337.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fut. part. act.</hi> incasurus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 27, 27, § 97</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> scanned incĭdĕrunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1174</bibl>), <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>in-cado</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to fall into</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upon</hi> a thing, <hi rend="ital">to fall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">light upon</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n22337.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n22337.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., constr. with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.;</hi> less freq. with other <hi rend="ital">prepp.</hi>, with the <case>dat.</case>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22337.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in foveam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 4, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex spelunca saxum in crura ejus incidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e nubi in nubem vis incidit ardens fulminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 145</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:296" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 296</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in segetem flamma,</quote> <trans><tr>falls</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:305" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 305</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pestilentia in urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut incideret luna tum in eam metam, quae esset umbra terrae, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>entered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:14:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 14, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in oculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 17, 73, § 187</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incidentibus vobis in vallum portasque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in laqueos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:314" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 314</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22337.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With other <hi rend="ital">prepp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">incidit ictus Ingens ad terram duplicato poplite Turnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:926" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 926</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(turris) super agmina late incidit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 467</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22337.5" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">incidere portis,</quote> <trans><tr>to rush into</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:11:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 11, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:26:8" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 26, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lymphis putealibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput incidit arae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 104</bibl></cit>: Sagunti <cb n="INCI" /> ruinae nostris capitibus incident, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 10, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultimis Romanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:13:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 13, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jacenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:233" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 233</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hi duo amnes confluentes incidunt Oriundi flumini,</quote> <trans><tr>empty</tr>, <tr>fall into</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:31:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 31, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modo serius incidis (sol) undis,</quote> <trans><tr>sink</tr>,</trans>
