<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 198</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22337.6" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa (hasta) volans, umeri surgunt qua tegmina summa, incidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:477" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 477</bibl></cit>: incidit Adriaci spatium admirabile rhombi, i. e. <hi rend="ital">into the fisherman</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s net</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:39" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 39</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n22337.7" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to fall upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meet</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">come upon unexpectedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fall in with</hi> a person or thing. </sense><sense id="n22337.8" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aliquem incurrere atque incidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum hic in me incidit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 41, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Valerius Procillus, cum in fuga catenis vinctus traheretur, in ipsum Caesarem incidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:53:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 53, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in insidias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in quos (milites), si qui ex acie fugerint, de improviso incidant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:52:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 52, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in manus alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vituperatores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 1, 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n22337.9" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter catervas armatorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22337.10" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (oculi) quocumque inciderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:50" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sane homini praeter opinionem improviso incidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:74:section=182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 74, § 182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incidit huic Appennicolae bellator filius Anni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:699" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 699</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22337.11" n="(d)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> alone (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">bene quod meas potissimum manus incidisti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 176, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> p. 179, 4: <cit><quote lang="la">fatales laqueos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulc. Gall.</author> Avid. Caes. 2, § 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22337.12" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to fall upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assault</hi>: triarii consurgentes ... in hostem incidebant. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:8:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 8, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam acrius ultimis incidebat Romanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:13:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 13, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n22337.13" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n22337.14" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to fall into</hi> any condition. </sense><sense id="n22337.15" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in morbum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:29:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 29, 4</bibl></cit>: in febriculam, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in miserias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 10, 24</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui inciderant (sc. in morbum) haud facile septimum diem superabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 21, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut si in hujusmodi amicitias ignari casu aliquo inciderint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:12:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 12, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quodsi quis etiam a culpa vacuus in amicitiam ejus inciderat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 14, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in honoris contentionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:10:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 10, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in imperiorum, honorum, gloriae cupiditatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:8:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 8, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in furorem et insaniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:20:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 20, 46</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n22337.16" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> alone: <cit><quote lang="la">caecitatem, Ambros. de Tobia, 2: iram,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Plac. Narr. Fab. 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amorem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22337.17" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To fall upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">befall</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo anno pestilentia gravis incidit in urbem agrosque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:23:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 23, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantus terror incidit ejus exercitui,</quote> <trans><tr>fell upon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 13, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nihil incidisset postea civitati mali, quod, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>happened</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 7, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22337.18" n="C" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n22337.19" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To fall upon</hi> accidentally; <hi rend="ital">to light upon</hi>, in thought or conversation: <cit><quote lang="la">non consulto, sed casu in eorum mentionem incidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:15:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 15, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 1, 3</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuito in sermonem alicujus incidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:24:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 24, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eum sermonem incidere, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in varios sermones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in eam memoriam et recordationem nuper ex sermone quodam incidissemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:2:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iterum in mentionem incidimus viri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:33:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 33, 1</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n22337.20" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To come</hi> or <hi rend="ital">occur</hi> to one's mind: <cit><quote lang="la">sapiens appeteret aliquid, quodcumque in mentem incideret et quodcumque tamquam occurreret,</quote> <trans><tr>come into his mind</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:16:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 16, 43</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 75</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">redeunti, ex ipsa re mihi incidit suspicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 2, 2, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta nunc suspicio de me incidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 4, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicam, verum, ut aliud ex alio incidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 3, 3, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil te effugiet atque omne. quod erit in re occurret atque incidet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:34:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 34, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potantibus his apud Sex. Tarquinium incidit de uxoribus mentio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:57:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 57, 6</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22337.21" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To fall upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">happen in</hi> a certain time. </sense><sense id="n22337.22" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod in id rei publicae tempus non incideris, sed veneris — judicio enim tuo, non casu in ipsum discrimen rerum contulisti tribunatum tuum—profecto vides, quanta vis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum aetas in eorum tempora, quos nominavi, incidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:12:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 12, 39</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 15, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam in eadem rei publicae tempora incidimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 8, 3</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">facies me in quem diem Romana incidant mysteria certiorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in Kalendas Januarias Compitaliorum dies incidisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (bella) in ejus aetatem gravissima inciderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 11, 16</bibl></cit>: in <cb n="INCI" /> eum annum quo erat Hortensius consul futurus, incidere, <hi rend="ital">to fall into</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to extend the case until</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:5:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 5, 4</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quintus annus cum in te praetorem incidisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:56:section=139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 56, § 139</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22337.23" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> alone (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut menses ... autumnale tempus inciderent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 1, § 44</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22337.24" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To fall out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">happen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occur</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et in nostra civitate et in ceteris, multis fortissimis atque optimis viris injustis judiciis tales casus incidisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 17, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid tibi durius inciderit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:15:28" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 15, 28</bibl></cit>; cf.: si casus inciderit, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 21, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">incidunt saepe tempora cum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:10:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 10, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eorum ipsorum, quae honesta sunt, potest incidere saepe contentio et comparatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 43, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potest incidere quaestio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum si quod minus usitatum incidat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in magnis quoque auctoribus incidunt aliqua vitiosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 2, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:70" default="NO">11, 1, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 27, 3</bibl>: ea accidisse non quia haec facta sunt, arbitror; <cit><quote lang="la">verum haec ideo facta, quia incasura erant illa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 27, 27, § 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quando ita incidat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 5, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">forte ita incidit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 23, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forte ita inciderat, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:46:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 46, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22337.25" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To fall in with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coincide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agree with</hi>, in opinion, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ne ipse incidat in Diodorum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:8:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 8, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22337.26" n="6" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To stumble upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undertake at random</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic existumes non me fortuito ad tuam amplitudinem meis officiis amplectendam incidisse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 8, 3</bibl></cit>.— Hence in <hi rend="ital">part. pres.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">incĭdentĭa</orth>, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occurrences</hi>, <hi rend="ital">events</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 5, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">22, 9, 2 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n22338" type="main" key="inci_do2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incīdo</orth>, <itype>cīdi, cīsum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-caedo</etym>, <sense id="n22338.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cut into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut open</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut up</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n22338.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">teneris arboribus incisis atque inflexis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 17, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 14, 30, § 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:section=58" default="NO" valid="yes">32, § 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inciditur vitro, lapide, osseisve cultellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 25, 54, § 115</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">palmes inciditur in medullam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 9, 11, § 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venam,</quote> <trans><tr>to open</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 6, 58, § 126</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 19</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">incisi nervi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 88, § 218</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circa vulnus scalpello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 27, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinnas,</quote> <trans><tr>to clip</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vites falce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulmo incisus,</quote> <trans><tr>cut up</tr>, <tr>divided</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:39:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 39, 85</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">eupatoria foliis per extremitates incisis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>notched</tr>, <tr>indented</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 6, 29, § 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos linum incidimus, legimus,</quote> <trans><tr>cut through</tr>, <tr>cut</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:667" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 667</bibl></cit>: corpora mortuorum, <hi rend="ital">to dissect</hi>, Cels. praef.: <cit><quote lang="la">nocentes homines vivos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid habet haruspex cur pulmo incisus etiam in bonis extis dirimat tempus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:39:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 39, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si rectum limitem rupti torrentibus pontes inciderint,</quote> <trans><tr>cut through</tr>, <tr>broken through</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:13:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 13, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">squamisque incisus adaestuat amnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:517" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 517</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non incisa notis marmcra publicis,</quote> <trans><tr>engraved</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:8:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 8, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabula ... his ferme incisa litteris fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n22338.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n22338.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To cut in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to carve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">engrave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inscribe</hi> on any thing; usually constr. with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>; less freq. with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>acc.</case>, the <case>dat.</case>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22338.4" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">id non modo tum scripserunt, verum etiam in aere incisum nobis tradiderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 65</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">foedus in columna aenea incisum et perscriptum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:23:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 23, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:63:section=154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 63, § 154</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in qua basi grandibus litteris P. Africani nomen erat incisum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 34</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">74: nomina in tabula incisa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:36:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 36, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">notum est carmen incisum in sepulcro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 17, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:29:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 29, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:14:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 14, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">incidens litteras in fago recenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 9, 14, § 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indicem in aeneis tabulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:101" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae vos incidenda in aere censuistis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:75:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 75, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22338.5" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (acta) ille in aes incidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:1:7:16" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 1, 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges in aes incisae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 57 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lege jam in aes incisā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:28" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ita erit gestum, lex erit, et in aes incidi jubebitis credo illa legitima: consules populum jure rogaverunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 10, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22338.6" n="(g)" level="5"> With <case>dat.</case> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">verba ceris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:529" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 529</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amores arboribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fastos marmoreo parieti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gramm. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen non trabibus aut saxis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:54:7" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 54, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">primum aliquid da, quod possim titulis incidere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>among your titles</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:69" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 69</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22338.7" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">incidebantur jam domi leges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:32:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 32, 87</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tabula his litteris incīsa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:29:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 29, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine delectu morum quisquis incisus est,</quote> <trans><tr>inscribed</tr>, <tr>registered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:28" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Victorem litteris incisis appellare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 6, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22338.8" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To make by</hi> <pb n="921" /> <cb n="INCI" /> <hi rend="ital">cutting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cut</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ferroque incidit acuto Perpetuos dentes et serrae repperit usum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:245" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 245</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novas incide faces, tibi ducitur uxor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:21:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 21, 3</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n22338.9" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n22338.10" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To break off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interrupt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put an end to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëma ad Caesarem, quod institueram, incidi,</quote> <trans><tr>have broken off</tr>, <tr>stopped</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:4:section=11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 4, § 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inciditur omnis jam deliberatio, si intellegitur non posse fieri, ?*!</quote><bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:82:336" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 82, 336</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:37:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 37, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tandem haec singultu verba incidente profatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:884" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 884</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novas lites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocis genus crebro incidens,</quote> <trans><tr>broken</tr>, <tr>interrupted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:58:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 58, 217</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22338.11" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To cut off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut short</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">media,</quote> <trans><tr>to cut short</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:19:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 19, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui mihi pinnas inciderant nolunt easdem renasci,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tarquinius spe omni reditus incisā exsulatum Tusculum abiit,</quote> <trans><tr>cut off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:15:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 15, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spe incisā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:58:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 58, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:31:7" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 31, 7</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 6, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 13, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantos actus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:78" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsam, quam promimus horam casus incidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 101" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testamentum,</quote> <trans><tr>to annul</tr>, <tr>invalidate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:4:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 4, 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22338.12" n="C" level="2"> In rhet., <hi rend="ital">to make by cutting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequaliter particulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:61:205" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 61, 205</bibl></cit>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n22338.13" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">incī-sum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, rhet. t. t. for the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ko/mma,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">a section</hi> or <hi rend="ital">division</hi> of a sentence, <hi rend="ital">a clause</hi>: quae nescio cur, cum Graeci <foreign lang="greek">ko/mmata</foreign> et <foreign lang="greek">kw=la</foreign> nominent, nos non recte incisa et membra dicamus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:62:211" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 62, 211</bibl> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">incisiones et membra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 64, 261</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">incisum erit sensus non expleto numero conclusus, plerisque pars membri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:122" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 122</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib. 22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 22</bibl>; 32; 44; 67; 123.—</sense><sense id="n22338.14" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">incīsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">in short clauses</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo pacto deceat incise membratimve dici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:63:212" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 63, 212</bibl></cit>; cf. incisim.</sense></entryFree>
inciduus: <entryFree id="n22339" type="main" key="inci_du^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incīdŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. incaeduus.</entryFree>
inciens: <entryFree id="n22340" type="main" key="inci^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>kindr. with <foreign lang="greek">e)/gkuos, e)gku/mwn</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n22340.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pregnant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with young</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:11:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 11, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sues,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 84, § 211</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partus incientis pecoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:16" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incilis: <entryFree id="n22341" type="main" key="inci_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incīlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>contr. from incīdilis, from incido</etym>, <sense id="n22341.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cut in</hi>: fossae, i. e. <hi rend="ital">ditches</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trenches</hi> for carrying off water, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 155, 1</bibl>.— Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n22341.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22341.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">incīle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a ditch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trench</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">incilia aperire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 155, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ducere incile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:13:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 13, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 221</bibl>: in incili omnia adhaeserunt, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 5, 3</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n22341.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">incīlis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, transl.: inciles <foreign lang="greek">diw/ruges</foreign> (i. e. <foreign lang="greek">diw/ruxes</foreign>), Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
incilo: <entryFree id="n22342" type="main" key="inci_lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incīlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n22342.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to rebuke</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blame</hi> (anteclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">jure increpet inciletque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:963" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 963</bibl></cit>: me oratione, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 125, 5</bibl> (Trag. Fragm. v. 136 Rib.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:ib. 7" default="NO"><author>Lucil.</author> ib. 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spernere, incilare probris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:ib. 1" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> ib. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">factum alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:ib. 3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3</bibl></cit> (Trag. Fragm. v. 41, 430, 458 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
incinctus: <entryFree id="n22343" type="main" key="incinctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incinctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from incingo.</entryFree>
incinefactus: <entryFree id="n22344" type="main" key="inci^ne^factus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incĭnĕfactus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = in cineres redactus, <sense id="n22344.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made ashes</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Commod.</author> Instr. 41, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incinerarium: <entryFree id="n22345" type="gloss" key="inci^ne^ra_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incĭnĕrārĭum</orth> <itype>muliebre ministerium</itype> (<sense id="n22345.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hair - dressing</hi>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 78</bibl> P. (cf. cinifio).</sense></entryFree>
incingo: <entryFree id="n22346" type="main" key="incingo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incingo</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-cingo, to enclose with a girdle; hence</etym>, <sense id="n22346.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to gird</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gird about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surround</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose; not used by Cic. in prose; esp. freq. in the <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">(aras) verbenis silvaque incinxit agresti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:242" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 242</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbes turritis moenibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:8:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 8, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incingi zonā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 9, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Arcadiam Peloponnesiacae gentes undique incingunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars sese tortis serpentibus incingebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 259</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Mid.: (Tisiphone) Induitur pallam tortoque incingitur angue,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:483" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 483</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nitidaque incingere lauro,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>crown thyself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:720" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 720</bibl></cit>.— In <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">incinctus cinctu Gabino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 9, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gabino cultu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: (Furiae) caerulea incinctae angui incedunt, Poët. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 28, 89</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambae (Nymphae) auro, pictis incinctae pellibus ambae,</quote> <trans><tr>girded</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:342" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 342</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:396" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 7, 396</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Lares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:634" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 634</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incinctus tunicas mercator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:675" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 675</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:894" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 13, 894</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(fons) margine gramineo patulos incinctus hiatus,</quote> <trans><tr>enclosed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:162" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 162</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incingulum: <entryFree id="n22347" type="gloss" key="incingu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incingŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>incingo</etym>, <sense id="n22347.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a girdle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cingulum a cingendo, quod incingulum plerumque dicitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 47, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incino: <entryFree id="n22348" type="main" key="inci^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incĭno</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>in-cano</etym>, <sense id="n22348.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to blow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sing</hi> (very rare; not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n22348.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">varios incinit ore modos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:22" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 22</bibl></cit> (3, 15), 6: frequentamenta quaedam<cb n="INCI" />  varia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:11:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 11, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n22348.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si modulislenibus tibicen incinat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:13:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 13, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incipesso: <entryFree id="n22349" type="main" key="inci^pesso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incĭpesso</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. incipisso.</entryFree>
incipio: <entryFree id="n22350" type="main" key="inci^pi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incĭpĭo</orth>, <itype>cēpi, ceptum, 3</itype> (archaic incepsit inceperit, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=107" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 107</bibl> Müll.), <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> [in-capio; lit., to seize upon, lay hold of; opp. to desinere; hence, with the accessory idea of action), <sense id="n22350.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to begin</hi> to do something, <hi rend="ital">to take in hand</hi> (syn. incoho; in class. prose, viz. in Cic., only in the <hi rend="ital">tempp. press.</hi>, while coepi is used in the <hi rend="ital">tempp. perff.</hi>); constr. usually with the <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, less freq. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, with the <case>acc.</case>, <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">adv. of place</hi> or <hi rend="ital">time.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22350.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22350.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut homines mortem vel optare incipiant vel certe timere desistant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:49:117" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 49, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic incipio sententiae diffidere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prius quam incipit tinnire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bella gerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:3:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges neglegere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 43 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">queri cum multis incipiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:23:section=56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 23, § 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimis cito diligere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:21:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 21, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amare aliquem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fossas complere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:51:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 51, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem frumentariam expedire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:54:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 54, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triplicem aciem ducere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 64, 7</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 30, 1: cum maturescere frumenta inciperent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 29, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 49, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum primum pabuli copia esse inciperet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 2, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ictus erat, qua crus esse incipit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 255</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8, 474</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 256</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">opes pellere dominatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 3:61:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 3, 61, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si res explicare incipiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Pelop. 1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Pelop. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bessus agere gratias incipit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:12:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cenare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:74" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promovere scalas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si dormire incipis ortu luciferi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:11" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">male quod mulier facere incepit, nisi id efficere perpetrat, etc.... Si bene facere incepit, etc. (shortly afterward, occeperunt),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 5, 12</bibl></cit> and 14: <cit><quote lang="la">satis nequam sum, utpote qui hodie inceperim Amare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 5, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22350.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut incipiendi ratio fuerit, ita sit desinendi modus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:37:135" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 37, 135</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 116" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 116</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum incipimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:144" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum deliberamus, quando incipiendum sit, incipere jam serum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:6:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in incipiendo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: ac statim sic rex incipit, <hi rend="ital">thus begins</hi> (to speak), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 109 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec sic incipies, ut scriptor cyclicus olim: Fortunam Priami, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic incipit, with a foll. direct quotation,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 6, 79</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:281" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 281</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and simply incipit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapere aude, Incipe,</quote> <trans><tr>make a beginning</tr>, <tr>begin</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:34" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">priusquam incipias, consulto opus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turpe inceptu est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incipientes atque adhuc teneri (pueri),</quote> <trans><tr>who are beginning to learn</tr>, <tr>beginners</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incipiens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 5, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:6:5" default="NO">2, 6, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO">8</bibl> prooem. § 1; 3; <cit><quote lang="la">10, 7, 18: quoties madidum ver incipit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:52 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 52 al.</bibl></cit> — </sense><sense id="n22350.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> (once in Cic., once in Cæs., <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>): <cit><quote lang="la">facinus audax incipit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 20, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugilatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 4, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid novi negotii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 4, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum (opp. deponere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 83:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 83, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam prava,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 64:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 64, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indigna nobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 2:41:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 41, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:34:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 34, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 21, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:37:9" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 37, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:43:3" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 43, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sementem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 230</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Maenalios versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 8, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si id facere non potueris, quod, ut opinio mea fert, ne incipies quidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:19:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 19, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 12, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter mihi incepi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum incepi operis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 3, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mandata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">auspicia a parricidio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 26, 2 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: multa, Cat. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:14:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 14, 2</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta incepta res est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuptiarum gratia haec sunt ficta atque incepta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 1, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 3, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si inceptam oppugnationem reliquissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 17, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia dici extremum erat, proelium non inceptum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 21, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelium incipitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 57:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 57, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">74, 2: saxis proelium incipitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis cito incipi victoriam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 76</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 67</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter inceptum celerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inceptumque decurre laborem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inceptum frustra summitte furorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:832" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 832</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus me vetat Inceptos iambos Ad umbilicum adducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:14:7" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 14, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in re incipiunda ad defendendam noxiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in contentionibus aut incipiendis aut finiendis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:128" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a tantis princeps incipiendus erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:570" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 570</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22350.5" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi> or an <hi rend="ital">adv. of place</hi> or <cb n="INCI" /> <hi rend="ital">time</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a Jove incipiendum putat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 36</bibl></cit> (acc. to the Gr. of Aratus, <foreign lang="greek">e)k *dio\s a)rxw/mesqa</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">ab illis incipit uxor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:348" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 348</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:46" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">incipiamus ab iis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semper ab excusatione aetatis incipientem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 3, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potissimum incipiam ab ea parte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">optime manus a sinistra parte incipit, in dextra deponitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:106" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitia incepta a parvis cum aetate accrevit simul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 3, 7</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">optime incipitur a longis, recte aliquando a brevibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:92" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 92</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n22350.6" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to begin to be</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to begin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commence</hi> (rare but class.); constr. with <hi rend="ital">abl. instrum.</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22350.7" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">tertius sinus Acrocerauniis incipit montibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 1, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">censere ut principium anni inciperet mense Decembri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum petere quo incipiant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22350.8" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ver esse coeperat ... cum rosam viderat, tum incipere ver arbitrabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:10:section=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 10, § 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoties incipit sensus aut desinit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:67" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic annus incipit vicesimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 5, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">narrationis incipit mihi initium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam tum inceperat turba inter eos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus erat quo prima quies mortalibus aegris Incipit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:269" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 269</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mox Idumaea incipit et Palaestina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 13, 14, § 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistula, quam incipiente febricula scripseras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incipientes curas principis onerari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incipiens adhuc et nondum adulta seditio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incipiens omnia sentit amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:648" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 648</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Menander Syracusanus incipientis juventae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 5, 5, § 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incipiente aestate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 13, 109, § 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trixago incipientibus hydropicis efficax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 15, 80, § 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem (honorem) et incipientes principes et desinentes adeo concupis cunt ut auferant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:57" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 57</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">in-ceptum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a beginning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attempt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undertaking</hi> (freq. in historians and poets, but not in Cæs.; <cit><quote lang="la">also rare in Cic.): cujus ego non modo factum, sed inceptum ullum conatumve contra patriam deprehendero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 12, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servetur ad imum, Qualis ab incepto processerit (persona),</quote> <trans><tr>from the beginning onwards</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 127</bibl></cit>: permanere in incepto, Luccei. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a quo incepto studioque me ambitio mala detinuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus neque consilium neque inceptum ullum frustra erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 7, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ni ea res longius nos ab incepto traheret,</quote> <trans><tr>the subject</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 7</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">absistere incepto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:26:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 26, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desistere incepto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haerere in incepto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 654</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peragere inceptum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 452</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">perficere inceptum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">piget incepti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:678" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 678</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc ad inceptum redeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 4, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:42:5" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">turpe inceptum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 4, 16</bibl></cit>.— In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupidus incepta patrandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 70:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 70, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juventus Catilinae inceptis favebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 17, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incepta mea inpedivit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 4:61:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 61, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inceptis annue, diva, meis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 2, 56</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">di nostra incepta secundent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 259</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravia et magna professa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incipisso: <entryFree id="n22351" type="main" key="inci^pisso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incĭpisso</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">incĭpesso</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>incipio</etym>, <sense id="n22351.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to begin</hi> (Plautin.): <cit><quote lang="la">quid hic homo tantum incipissit facere cum tantis minis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nugas ineptiasque maxumas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnam rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic rationem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">brevem orationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 1, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 42</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incircum: <entryFree id="n22352" type="hapax" key="incircum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-circum</orth>, <pos>prep.</pos>, <sense id="n22352.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">round about</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod incircum cum locum aquae frigidae et caldae multae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=25" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 25</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. Hand, Turs. ad h. v.</sense></entryFree>
incircumcisus: <entryFree id="n22353" type="main" key="incircumci_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-circumcīsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22353.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">uncircumcised</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Jud. 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 389</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incircumscriptus: <entryFree id="n22354" type="main" key="incircumscriptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-circumscriptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22354.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unlimited</hi>, <hi rend="ital">infinite</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">dominus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 863</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incise: <entryFree id="n22355" type="main" key="inci_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incīsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. incīdo <sense id="n22355.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> C. 2.</sense></entryFree>
incisim: <entryFree id="n22356" type="main" key="inci_sim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incīsim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>incisus, from 2. incīdo</etym>, <sense id="n22356.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in short clauses</hi> (very rare): haec quidem duo binis pedibus incisim; <cit><quote lang="la">deinde membratim, etc. (shortly before: incise membratimve),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:63:213" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 63, 213</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incisim et membratim tractata oratio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 67, 225</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incisio: <entryFree id="n22357" type="main" key="inci_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incīsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. incīdo</etym>. <sense id="n22357.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A cutting into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incision</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne incisio vulnus exasperet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 37, § 42</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n22357.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n22357.2" n="A" level="2"> Rhet. t. t, <hi rend="ital">an incision</hi>, i. e. <pb n="922" /> <cb n="INCI" /> <hi rend="ital">a division</hi>, <hi rend="ital">member</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clause</hi> of a sentence, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ko/mma</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">de eorum (circuituum) particulis et tamquam incisionibus disserendum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:61:206" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 61, 206</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in incisionibus et in membris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 64, 216</bibl></cit>; cf. incisum under 2. incido <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> C.—</sense><sense id="n22357.3" n="B" level="2"> Gramm. t. t., <hi rend="ital">a cæsura</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 496</bibl> P.—</sense><sense id="n22357.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A griping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">colic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">interiorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 39</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incisum: <entryFree id="n22358" type="main" key="inci_sum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incīsum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. 2. incīdo <sense id="n22358.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> C.</sense></entryFree>
incisura: <entryFree id="n22359" type="main" key="inci_su_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incīsūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. incīdo</etym>, <sense id="n22359.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cutting into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incision</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incisure</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n22359.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:54:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 54, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 39, 94, § 231</bibl>. —<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 21, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n22359.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n22359.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A natural incision</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indentation;</hi> as in the palm of the hand, the bodies of insects, in leaves, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 52, 114, § 274</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 1, 1, § 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:37" default="NO" valid="yes">15, 11, 11, § 37</bibl>; 26, 8, 29, § 46.— </sense><sense id="n22359.4" n="B" level="2"> In painting, <hi rend="ital">a division between the light and shade</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 13, 57, § 163</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incisus: <entryFree id="n22360" type="main" key="inci_sus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incīsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from 2. incīdo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n22361" type="hapax" key="inci_sus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incīsus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>2. incīdo</etym>, <sense id="n22361.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an incision</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">proximo anno ab incisu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 12, 23, § 60</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incitabilis: <entryFree id="n22362" type="gloss" key="inci^ta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incĭtābĭlis</orth> <foreign lang="greek">parocuntiko/s,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</entryFree>
incitabulum: <entryFree id="n22363" type="hapax" key="inci^ta_bu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incĭtābŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>incito</etym>, <sense id="n22363.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an incentive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stimulus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenii virtutisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:2:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incitamentum: <entryFree id="n22364" type="main" key="inci^ta_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incĭtāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22364.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an incitement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inducement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incentive.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22364.1" n="I" level="1"> In abstr. with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: et periculorum et laborum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 10, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">educandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:27:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 27, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 12 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad honeste moriendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:5:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 5, 4</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ad incessendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:11:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 11, 5</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">quo</hi> and <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inclinatio senatus incitamentum Tiberio fuit quo promptius adversaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 38</bibl></cit>.— In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">incitamenta irarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:14:1 al" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 14, 1 al.</bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n22364.2" n="II" level="1"> In concr., of persons (in Tac.): <cit><quote lang="la">Sextia uxor, quae incitamentum mortis et particeps fuit,</quote> <trans><tr>that instigated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">acerrima seditionum ac discordiae incitamenta interfectores Galbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2</bibl></cit>. 23.</sense></entryFree>
incitate: <entryFree id="n22365" type="main" key="inci^ta_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incĭtātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. incito, <sense id="n22365.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
incitatio: <entryFree id="n22366" type="main" key="inci^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incĭtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>incito</etym>, <sense id="n22366.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an inciting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incitement</hi> in an act. and pass. sense (Ciceron.). </sense><sense id="n22366.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an inciting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rousing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instigating</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">languentis populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:9:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 9, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acris et vehemens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 43, 183</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22366.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violent motion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rapidity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vehemence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ardor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">energy.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22366.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (sol) tanta incitatione fertur, ut, celeritas ejus quanta sit, ne cogitari quidem possit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 26, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejaculari incitatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 84" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 84</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22366.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: est quaedam animi incitatio atque alacritas naturaliter innata omnibus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:92:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 92, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:40:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 40, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic evolavit oratio, ut ejus vim atque incitationem aspexerim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:35:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 35, 161</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incitator: <entryFree id="n22367" type="main" key="inci^ta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incĭtātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22367.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an inciter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instigator</hi> (post-class.): Fauni vaticinantium incitatores, Front. Eloqu. <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>; Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef.</foreign> 10, 67: <cit><quote lang="la">male sanus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 28, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incitatrix: <entryFree id="n22368" type="main" key="inci^ta_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incĭtātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>incitator</etym>, <sense id="n22368.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that incites</hi> or <hi rend="ital">instigates</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">ad vitia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libidinum (opulentia),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Ira D. 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">licentiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nazar.</author> Pan. ad Const. 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incitatus: <entryFree id="n22369" type="main" key="inci^ta_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incĭtātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from incito.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n22370" type="hapax" key="inci^ta_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incĭtātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>incito</etym>, <sense id="n22370.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rapid motion;</hi> v. l. for incitu, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 45, 45, § 116</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incitega: <entryFree id="n22371" type="gloss" key="inci^te_ga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incĭtēga</orth> <itype>machinula, in qua constituebatur in convivio vini amphora, de qua subinde deferrentur vina</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=107" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 107</bibl> Müll. [mutilated from <foreign lang="greek">e)gguqh/kh</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">a)ggoqh/kh;</foreign> v. Müll. <sense id="n22371.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>].</sense></entryFree>
incito: <entryFree id="n22372" type="main" key="inci^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-cĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n22372.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to set in rapid motion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hasten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">urge forwards;</hi> and with se, <hi rend="ital">to put one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self in rapid motion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hasten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rush</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n22372.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n22372.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">vehementius equos incitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:41:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 41, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa per pronum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 3, 22</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">hastas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:409" default="NO"><author>Val.
