Fl.</author> 1, 409</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stellarum motus tum incitantur, tum retardantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:40:103" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 40, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves longas remis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 25, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lintres magno sonitu remorum incitatae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 60, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navigio remis incitato,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 14, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alii ex castris sese incitant,</quote> <trans><tr>sally out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 14, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ex alto se aestus incitavisset,</quote> <trans><tr>had rushed in</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 3, 12, 1</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">quo major vis aquae se incitavisset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 17, 7</bibl></cit>: duabus ex partibus sese (naves) in eam (navem) incitaverant, <cb n="INCI" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 6, 4</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 24, 3</bibl>.—Prov.: incitare currentem, <hi rend="ital">to spur a willing horse</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to urge a person who does not need urging</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 8, 19</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 16</bibl>; v. curro.—</sense><sense id="n22372.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to cause to grow larger</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to augment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">increase</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to promote the growth of</hi> (not ante-Aug.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">excito, I. B.): hibernis (Enipeus amnis) incitatus pluviis,</quote> <trans><tr>swollen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frequentibus fossuris terra permiscetur, ut incitari vitis possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:22:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 22, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:33" default="NO">4, 33</bibl>. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 3, 21, 7.—</sense><sense id="n22372.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to incite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encourage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stimulate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rouse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spur on.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22372.5" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem imitandi cupiditate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:92:317" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 92, 317</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus (causis) mentes aut incitantur aut reflectuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:32:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 32, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos, opp. sedare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:19:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 19, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsum ingenium diligentia etiam ex tarditate incitat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 35, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum studio legendi meum scribendi studium in dies incitatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam ea incitatur in civitate ratio vivendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:60:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 60, 226</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stultas cogitationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:10:4" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam ad hanc voluntatem ipsius naturae stimulis incitamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenes ad studium et ad laborem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:61:262" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 61, 262</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad servandum genus hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:20:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 20, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa Caesarem ad id bellum incitabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad bellum atque arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 27, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad amplissimam spem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus voluptatis avidae libidines temere et effrenate ad potiundum incitarentur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 12, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incitabant (animum ferocem) praeterea conrupti civitatis mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tibia lumbos incitat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:315" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 315</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n22372.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n22372.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To inspire.</hi> nam terrae vis Pythiam Delphis incitabat, naturae Sibyllam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:36:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 36, 79</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mente incitati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 5, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:63:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 63, 93</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n22372.8" n="2" level="3"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">to excite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arouse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stir up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque enim desunt, qui istos in me atque in optimum quemque incitent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 28, 66</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 2, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et consules senatum in tribunum et tribunus populum in consules incitabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his vocibus cum in se magis incitarent dictatorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:33:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 33, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opifices facile contra vos incitabuntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 47, 144</bibl></cit> (shortly before, concitentur); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:35" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 35 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites nostri pristini diei perfidiā incitati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas ob eam rem incitata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 4, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22372.9" n="3" level="3"> (Acc. to I. B.) <hi rend="ital">To augment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">increase</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enhance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuetudo exercitatioque et intellegendi prudentiam acuit et eloquendi celeritatem incitat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:20:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 20, 90</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">caelibum poenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 25</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">incĭtātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (set in rapid motion; hence), <hi rend="ital">swiftly running</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sailing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flying</hi>, etc.; in gen., <hi rend="ital">rapid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swift.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22372.10" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperator equo incitato se in hostes immittens,</quote> <trans><tr>at full speed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:6:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equo incitato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (for which: citato equo; <cit><quote lang="la">v. cito): milites cursu incitato in summo colle ab hostibus conspiciebantur,</quote> <trans><tr>advancing rapidly</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 26, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">in the foll. B.: mundi incitatissima conversio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 18</bibl></cit> (shortly before: conversio concitatior).— </sense><sense id="n22372.11" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursus in oratione incitatior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:59:201" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 59, 201</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">so of speech: Herodotus sine ullis salebris quasi sedatus amnis fluit: Thucydides incitatior fertur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 39</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">incĭtātē</orth> (acc. to B.), of speech, <hi rend="ital">quickly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rapidly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluit incitatius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:63:212" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 63, 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod incitatius feratur (locutio),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 20, 67</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incitus: <entryFree id="n22373" type="main" key="inci^tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-cĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22373.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">set in rapid motion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rapid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swift</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violent</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">venti vis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:271" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 271</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inciti atque alacres Delphini, Cic. poët. N. D. 2, 35, 89: hasta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:492" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 492</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:491" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 491</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longis Porticibus conjux fugit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:728" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 728</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n22374" type="main" key="inci^tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-citus, unmoved; hence</etym>, of a chessman that cannot be moved, <sense id="n22374.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">immovable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(calculi) qui moveri omnino non possunt, incitos dicunt. Unde et egentes homines inciti vocantur, quibus spes ultra procedendi nulla restat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 18, 67</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22374.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">incĭtae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype> (sc. calces), <gen>f.</gen>, and </sense><sense id="n22374.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">incĭta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> Used only in the ante- and post-class. authors in the transf. phrase, ad incita or ad incitas aliquem redigere, deducere, redire, etc., <hi rend="ital">to bring to a stand-still</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reduce to extremity: Sy.</hi> Profecto ad incitas lenonem rediget, si eas abduxerit. <hi rend="ital">Mi.</hi> Quin prius <cb n="INCL" /> disperibit faxo, quam unam calcem civerit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 85</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ad incitast redactus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 136</bibl></cit> Brix: vilicum corrupit, ad incita redegit, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 123, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud ad incita cum redit atque internecionem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Epirotae ad incitas intolerandi tributi mole depressi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mamert.</author> Grat. Act. ad Jul. 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n22375" type="main" key="inci^tus3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incĭtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>in-cieo</etym>, <sense id="n22375.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">quick motion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adsiduo mundi incitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 45, 45, § 116</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incivilis: <entryFree id="n22376" type="main" key="inci_vi_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-cīvīlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22376.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unmannerly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impolite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uncivil;</hi> hence, also, <hi rend="ital">unreasonable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unjust</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">homo ferus et incivilis ingenii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 9, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saevi atque inciviles animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 22" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba, tam improba ac tam incivilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:6:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:19:9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 19, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">factum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:13:3" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 50, 13, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:2:67" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 23, 2, 67</bibl>. — <hi rend="ital">Neutr. plur.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">in-cīvīlĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">impolite acts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rudeness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multis incivilibus gestis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 10, 13</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">incīvīlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">without civility</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uncourteously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem tractare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extorta (bona),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:2:23" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">instituti novi rivi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:13:2" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 50, 13, 2</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praefecturam egit aliquanto incivilius et violentius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:26" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incivilitas: <entryFree id="n22377" type="main" key="inci_vi_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incīvīlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>incivilis</etym>, <sense id="n22377.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">uncourteousness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incivility</hi> (post - class. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">per incivilitatem militis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">29, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inciviliter: <entryFree id="n22378" type="main" key="inci_vi_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incīvīlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. incivilis <sense id="n22378.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
inclamatio: <entryFree id="n22379" type="main" key="incla_ma_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inclāmātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>inclamo</etym>, <sense id="n22379.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a calling out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exclaiming against</hi> one (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">imprecationis et comminationis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inclamito: <entryFree id="n22380" type="hapax" key="incla_mi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inclāmĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22380.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to call out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">exclaim against</hi> one; hence, <hi rend="ital">to abuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scold</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inclamitor quasi servus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 5, 2, 46</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inclamo: <entryFree id="n22381" type="main" key="incla_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-clāmo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <sense id="n22381.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To cry out to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to call upon</hi>, in a good or bad sense. </sense><sense id="n22381.1" n="A" level="2"> In a good sense (class.), <hi rend="ital">to call upon</hi> for assistance, <hi rend="ital">to invoke.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22381.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">comitem suum inclamavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:4:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fulvium Taurea nomine inclamavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:15:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 15, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delphinus inclamatus a puero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 8, 8, § 25</bibl></cit>: nomen alicujus, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:124" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 124</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n22381.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita te para, ut, si inclamaro, advoles,</quote> <trans><tr>call out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 20, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo inclamavit patronorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 53 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi inclamaret aut testaretur locutus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:172" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 172</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22381.4" n="B" level="2"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">to call out against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exclaim against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rebuke</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abuse</hi> (mostly ante-class. and post-Aug.; perh. not in Cic.): inclamare conviciis et maledictis insectari, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=108" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 108</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">nolito acriter Eum inclamare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:3:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 3, 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aliquem,</quote> <trans><tr>to cry out aloud</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra aliquem voce quam maximā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 12" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quo tu turpissime, magnā Inclamat voce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pastorum unus ... inclamat alios, quid cessarent, cum, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>loudly remonstrates</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 4, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22381.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To cry aloud</hi>, <hi rend="ital">call out.</hi>—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum Albanus exercitus inclamat Curiatiis, uti opem ferant fratri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:25:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 25, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timidae puellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:7:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 7, 45</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inclango: <entryFree id="n22382" type="main" key="inclango"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inclango</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> (late Lat.), Jul. ap. Aug. cont. Sec. VI. 28.</entryFree>
inclaresco: <entryFree id="n22383" type="main" key="incla_resco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-clāresco</orth>, <itype>rŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n22383.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22383.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to become clear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">light</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">ubi primum dies inclaruit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 25, 1, 1</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n22383.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to become famous</hi> or <hi rend="ital">celebrated</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">docendi genere maxime inclaruit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gramm. 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque mea fortuna neque tua gloria inclaruisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 130</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in auro caelando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 12, 55, § 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae artes pluribus inclaruere exemplis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 37, 38, § 125</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inclarus: <entryFree id="n22384" type="main" key="incla_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-clārus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22384.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">obscure</hi> (late Lat. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">fides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 3:4" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 3, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inclemens: <entryFree id="n22385" type="main" key="incle_mens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-clēmens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22385.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unmerciful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rigorous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harsh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">severe</hi> (as an <pos>adj.</pos> perh. not ante-Aug. and very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cicero): increpabant inclementem dictatorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:32:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 32, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signifer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:440" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 440</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbo inclementiori appellari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:34:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 34, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inclementissimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 10</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">inclēmenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">rigorously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harshly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roughly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">severely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aliquem dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 110</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">loqui alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:5:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 5, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">increpantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 22, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil dictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:38:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 38, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">censuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18</bibl></cit>, <pb n="923" /> 6,7, § <cit><quote lang="la">35: si quis est, qui dictum in se inclementius existimabit esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:prol. 4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. prol. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inclementius invehi in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:48:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 48, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inclementer: <entryFree id="n22386" type="main" key="incle_menter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inclēmenter</orth>, <sense id="n22386.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">aav.</hi>, v. inclemens.</sense></entryFree>
inclementia: <entryFree id="n22387" type="main" key="incle_menti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inclēmentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>inclemens</etym>, <sense id="n22387.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unmercifulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rigor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harshness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roughness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">severity</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-class. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">divum inclementia, divum, Has evertit opes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:602" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 602</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">durae mortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravis fati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:4:50" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 4, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. G. 210</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dirae formae (Plutonis),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 1, 82</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inclinabilis: <entryFree id="n22388" type="main" key="incli_na_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inclīnābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>inclino</etym>, <sense id="n22388.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that readily leans to</hi> any thing, <hi rend="ital">prone.</hi>—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pravum inclinabiles animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 94:40" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 94, 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22388.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Not to be moved</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bent</hi> (lat. Lat.): atque immobilis permansit, (Hilar.) Anon. in Job, 1, p. 104.</sense></entryFree>
inclinamentum: <entryFree id="n22389" type="hapax" key="incli_na_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inclīnāmentum</orth>, <itype>ī</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, in gram., <sense id="n22389.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the formative termination</hi> of a word: inclinamentum hujuscemodi verborum, ut vinosus, mulierosus, numosus, signat copiam quandam immodicam rei, Nigid. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:9:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 9, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inclinatio: <entryFree id="n22390" type="main" key="incli_na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inclīnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22390.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a leaning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bending</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inclining</hi> to one side (class., esp. in the trop. signif.). </sense><sense id="n22390.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n22390.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">(corporis) ingressus, cursus, accubitio, inclinatio, sessio, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:34:94" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 34, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 11, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortis ac virilis laterum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib. 18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incumbentis in mulierculam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alternā egerunt scobem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 43, 83, § 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">merso navigio inclinatione lateris unius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 51, 77, § 208</bibl></cit>.— In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">variis trepidantium inclinationibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 58, § 160</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n22390.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic.: caeli, a transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kli/ma,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">the inclination</hi> or <hi rend="ital">slope</hi> of the earth from the equator to the pole, <hi rend="ital">a parallel of latitude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clime</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:1:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 1, 8</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which, mundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22390.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an inclination</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tendency.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22390.5" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad meliorem spem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:31:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 31, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crudelitas est inclinatio animi ad asperiora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 2:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 2, 4 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alii (loci communes) ad totius causae inclinationem (faciunt),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:57" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 57</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22390.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">inclination</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bias</hi>, <hi rend="ital">favor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluntatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:29:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 29, 129</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">voluntatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:26:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 26, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicum ad aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">principum inclinatio in hos, offensio in illos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utendum ea inclinatione Caesar ratus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:31:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 31, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 92</bibl></cit> — </sense><sense id="n22390.7" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n22390.8" n="1" level="3"> (Qs., a leaning or bending out of its former position; hence.) <hi rend="ital">An alteration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">change</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">communium temporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:26:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 26, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an ignoratis, populi Romani vectigalia perlevi saepe momento fortunae inclinatione temporis pendere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:29:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 29, 80</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 10, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc amplius Theophrastus (scripsit), quae essent in re publica rerum inclinationes et momenta temporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:4:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inclinationes temporum atque momenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 10, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:39:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 39, 94</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n22390.9" n="2" level="3"> Rhet. t. t.: vocis, <hi rend="ital">the play of the voice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">its elevation and depression</hi> in impassioned speech, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:43:158" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 43, 158</bibl>; <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:168" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 168</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n22390.10" n="3" level="3"> In the old gram. lang., <hi rend="ital">the formation</hi> or <hi rend="ital">derivation</hi> of a word, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 1</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
inclinativus: <entryFree id="n22391" type="main" key="incli_na_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inclīnātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, in gram., the Greek <foreign lang="greek">e)gklitiko/s,</foreign> <sense id="n22391.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">enclitic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjunctiones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1225</bibl></cit> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">pronomina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1062</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
inclinatus: <entryFree id="n22392" type="main" key="incli_na_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inclīnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from inclino.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n22393" type="hapax" key="incli_na_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inclīnātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>inclino</etym>, in gram., <sense id="n22393.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the formation</hi> or <hi rend="ital">derivation</hi> of a word: <cit><quote lang="la">simili inclinatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:12:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 12, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inclinis: <entryFree id="n22394" type="main" key="incli_nis1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inclīnis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-clino</etym>, <sense id="n22394.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bending</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bowing</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">cervix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:307" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 307</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inclinis atque humilis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Min. Fel.</author> Oct. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n22395" type="main" key="incli_nis2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inclīnis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-clino</etym>, <sense id="n22395.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unbending</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unalterable</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 1, 596</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inclino: <entryFree id="n22396" type="main" key="incli_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-clīno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>clino, clinatus</etym>. <sense id="n22396.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cause to lean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incline</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turn</hi> a thing in any direction; <hi rend="ital">to bend down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bow</hi> a thing. </sense><sense id="n22396.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n22396.2" n="1" level="3"> In gen. (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">vela contrahit malosque inclinat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:44:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 44, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genua arenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:356" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 356</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(rector maris) omnes Inclinavit aquas ad avarae litora Trojae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:209" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 209</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inclinato in dextrum capite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:119" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 119</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib. 69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inclinata utrolibet cervix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 11, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pollice intus inclinato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:99" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor Inclinat varias pondere nigra comas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:77:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 77, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic super Actaeas agilis Cyllenius arces Inclinat cursus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:721" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 721</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at mihi non oculos quisquam inclinavit euntes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>closed my sinking eyes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 7, 23 (Müll. inclamavit euntis): <cit><quote lang="la">prius sol meridie se inclinavit, quam, etc.,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>declined</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:32:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 32, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inclinato jam in postmeridianum tempus die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:3:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 3, 7</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Mid.: inclinari ad judicem (opp. reclinari ad suos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:132" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 132</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">(terra) inclinatur retroque recellit,</quote> <trans><tr>bends down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:573" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 573</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa inclinatis per humum quaesita lacertis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:63" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 63</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22396.3" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n22396.4" n="a" level="4"> In milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">to cause to fall back</hi> or <hi rend="ital">give way</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut Hostus cecidit, confestim Romana inclinatur acies,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>loses ground</tr>, <tr>retreats</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum inclinari rem in fugam apparuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:33:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 33, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasdam acies inclinatas jam et labantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 8</bibl></cit>; cf. under II. — </sense><sense id="n22396.5" n="b" level="4"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to turn back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cause to move backward</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">septemtrio inclinatum stagnum eodem quo aestus ferebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:45:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 45, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum primum aestu fretum inclinatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 7, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22396.6" n="c" level="4"> In mal. part., <hi rend="ital">to lie down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stretch out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam inclinabo me cum liberta tua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quot discipulos inclinet Hamillus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:224" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 224</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsos maritos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 26</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22396.7" n="3" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of color, <hi rend="ital">to incline to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">colore ad aurum inclinato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 11, 10, § 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coloris in luteum inclinati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 15, 86, § 136</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22396.8" n="4" level="3"> Of a disease, <hi rend="ital">to abate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diminish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbus inclinatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">febris se inclinat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> al.— </sense><sense id="n22396.9" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n22396.10" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to turn</hi> or <hi rend="ital">incline</hi> a person or thing in any direction: <cit><quote lang="la">se ad Stoicos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:3:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">culpam in aliquem,</quote> <trans><tr>to lay the blame upon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 8, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo se fortuna, eodem etiam favor hominum inclinat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 5, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicem inclinat miseratio,</quote> <trans><tr>moves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec animum inclinant, ut credam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:33:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 33, 10</bibl></cit>.—Mid.: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam inclinari opes ad Sabinos, rege inde sumpto videbantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:18:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 18, 5</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22396.11" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n22396.12" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To change</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alter</hi>, and esp. for the worse, <hi rend="ital">to bring down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abase</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cause to decline</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se fortuna inclinaverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:52:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 52, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia simul inclinante fortuna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut me paululum inclinari timore viderunt, sic impulerunt,</quote> <trans><tr>to give way</tr>, <tr>yield</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:80" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 80</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22396.13" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To throw upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transfer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec omnia in dites a pauperibus inclinata onera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:43:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 43, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia onera, quae communia quondam fuerint, inclinasse in primores civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:47:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 47, 12</bibl></cit>.—In gram., <hi rend="ital">to form</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inflect</hi> a word by a change of termination (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">(vinosus aut vitiosus) a vocabulis, non a verbo inclinata sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:12:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 12, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:9:12" default="NO">4, 9, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:5:9" default="NO">18, 5, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">partim hoc in loco adverbium est, neque in casus inclinatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:13:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 13, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22396.14" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incline</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decline</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sink.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22396.15" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare, and not in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">paulum inclinare necesse est corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 243</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol inclinat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:316" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 316</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inclinare meridiem sentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:28:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 28, 5</bibl></cit> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">sol se inclinavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:32:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 32, 6</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. above I. A. 1.): in vesperam inclinabat dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:11:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 11, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22396.16" n="2" level="3"> In partic., in milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">to yield</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give way</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita conflixerunt, ut aliquamdin in neutram partem inclinarent acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:33:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 33, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in fugam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inclinantes jam legiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 83</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n22396.17" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To change</hi> for the worse, <hi rend="ital">turn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fail</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si fortuna belli inclinet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:61:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 61, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde initia magistratuum nostrum meliora ferme, et finis inclinat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 21</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n22396.18" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to incline to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be favorably disposed towards</hi> any thing (also in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">si se dant et sua sponte quo impellimus, inclinant et propendent, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:44:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 44, 187</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecquid inclinent ad meum consilium adjuvandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:29:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 29, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad voluptatem audientium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:10:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 10, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in stirpem regiam studiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:7:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 7, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicus dulcis, Cum mea compenset vitiis bona, pluribus hisce ... inclinet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sententia senatus inclinaret ad pacem cum Pyrrho foedusque faciendum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">color ad crocum inclinans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 12, 105, § 128</bibl></cit>: omnia repente ad Romanos inclinaverunt. <hi rend="ital">turned in favor of</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:40:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 40, 14</bibl>. — With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut belli causa dictatorem creatum arbitrer, inclinat animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multorum eo inclinabant sententiae, ut tempus pugnae differretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:46:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 46, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hos ut sequar inclinat animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 24, 2</bibl></cit>. — With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inclinavit sententia, suum in Thessaliam agmen demittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 13, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inclinavit sententia universos ire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:25:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 25, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:57:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 57, 11</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consules ad patrum causam inclinati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:65:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 65, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inclinatis ad suspicionem mentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inclinatis ad credendum animis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:51:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 51, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad paenitentiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 45</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n22396.19" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to change</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alter</hi> from its former condition (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">inclinant jam fata ducum,</quote> <trans><tr>change</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:752" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 752</bibl></cit>. — Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">in-clīnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n22396.20" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Bent down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sunken</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">senectus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> 5, 13</bibl></cit>; of the voice, <hi rend="ital">low</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deep</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:17:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 17, 56</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inclinata ululantique voce more Asiatico canere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 27</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n22396.21" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Inclined</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disposed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prone to</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">plebs ante inclinatior ad Poenos fuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:46:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 46, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebs ad regem Macedonasque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:30:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 30, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsius imperatoris animus ad pacem inclinatior erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:33:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 33, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 81</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n22396.22" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Sunken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fallen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deteriorated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab excitata fortuna ad inclinatam et prope jacentem desciscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">copiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Pelop. 5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Pelop. 5, 4</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">neutr. plur. subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum inclinata ferre,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>troubles</tr>, <tr>misfortunes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:119" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 119</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inclitus: <entryFree id="n22397" type="main" key="incli^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inclĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. inclutus <sense id="n22397.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
includo: <entryFree id="n22398" type="main" key="inclu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-clūdo</orth>, <itype>si, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>claudo</etym>, <sense id="n22398.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to shut up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shut in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enclose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imprison</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keep in</hi> (class.).—Constr. with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>, <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>acc.</case>, rarely with the simple <case>abl.</case>, <case>dat.</case>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22398.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n22398.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">habemus senatusconsultum inclusum in tabulis, tamquam in vagina reconditum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armatos in cella Concordiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:12:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 12, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in uno cubiculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:53:section=133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 53, § 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in curia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 2, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne animal in mundo intus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum sumus inclusi in his compagibus corporis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 21, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consule in carcere incluso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">avis inclusa in cavea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:35:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 35, 73</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(Animus) inclusus in corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veriti, ne includerentur vento in hostium orā,</quote> <trans><tr>weather-bound on the coast</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:24:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 24, 9</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22398.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in custodias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:55:section=144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 55, § 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in carcerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 59 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n22398.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With the simple <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">inclusi parietibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem carcere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:60:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 60, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vim terrae cavernis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:36:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 36, 79</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 15, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inclusus caveā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:521" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 521</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minora castra inclusa majoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:66:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 66, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 67</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">grandes zmaragdos auro,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to set</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1127</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">suras auro,</quote> <trans><tr>to sheathe</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:488" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 488</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 430</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inclusus carcere nassae,</quote> <trans><tr>caught</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:123" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 123</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22398.5" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora furtim Includunt caeco lateri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">publicae custodiae aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 6</bibl></cit>, ext. 3.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, or with <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inclusum atque abditum latere in occulto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fila numerata porri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:133" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intrat positas inclusa per aequora moles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars Heracleae incluserunt sese,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:17:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 17, 9</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: Aetolorum utraeque manus Heracleam sese incluserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 16, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis alienum hominem aut pecudem incluserit et fame necaverit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:219" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 219</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc aliena ex arbore germen Includunt,</quote> <trans><tr>ingraft</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 76</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n22398.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n22398.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To obstruct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hinder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stop up</hi> (rare, and mostly post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">dolor includit vocem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:17:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 17, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuli primo tam novae rei admiratio incluserat vocem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:58:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 58, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 84, § 209</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimas (dolor),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:318" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 318</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">os alicui insertā spongiā, Sen. de Ira, 3, 10: post inclusum volatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 26, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. 7, 5, 4.— </sense><sense id="n22398.8" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To bound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">limit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Asiam in duas partes Agrippa divisit: unam inclusit ab oriente Phrygia . . . alteram determinavit ab oriente Armenia minore, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 28, § 102</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n22398.9" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n22398.10" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to include</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enclose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insert</hi> in any thing. </sense><sense id="n22398.11" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">qua de re agitur illud, quod multis locis in jurisconsultorum includitur formulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:79:275" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 79, 275</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">similem sui speciem in clipeo Minervae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:15:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 15, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animorum salus inclusa in ipsa est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 27, 58</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22398.12" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hujus me tu consilii societatem tamquam in equum Trojanum cum principibus includis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 13, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam (opinationem) in omnes definitiones superiores inclusimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:7:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 7, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 19, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eos in eam formam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:5:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <pb n="924" /> <cb n="INCO" /> orationem in epistulam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 16, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 7, 24</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n22398.13" n="(g)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case> (freq. in Liv.): <cit><quote lang="la">illa quae mihi sunt inclusa medullis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 4, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:17:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 17, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 8, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio libro inclusa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:25:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 25, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba versu includere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:48:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 48, 184</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si aperias haec, quae verbo uno inclusa erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:68" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:66" default="NO">12, 10, 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">antiquo me includere ludo quaeris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22398.14" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <foreign lang="greek">topoqesi/an</foreign> quam postulas, includam orationi meae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 13, 5</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:25:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 25, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas aureae armillae inclusas gestavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:6:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 6, 3</bibl></cit>.— (<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">adv. of place</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">intus inclusum periculum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 5, 11</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22398.15" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n22398.16" n="1" level="3"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">to close</hi>, <hi rend="ital">finish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">end</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">sic nobis, qui nunc magnum spiramus amantes, Forsitan includet crastina fata dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:15" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 15</bibl></cit> (3, 7), 54; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:686" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 686</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora quae semel Notis condita fastis Inclusit (= consignavit), volucris dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:13:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 13, 16</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">hujus actionem (vespera),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:11:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 11, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mellationem idibus Nov. fere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 16, 15, § 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes potiones aqua frigida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n22398.17" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To restrain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">control</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus imperatorem, nullis neque temporis nec juris inclusum angustiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 8, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inclusio: <entryFree id="n22399" type="main" key="inclu_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inclūsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>includo</etym>, <sense id="n22399.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shutting up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confinement.</hi> * </sense><sense id="n22399.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bibulum, cujus inclusione contentus non eras, interficere volueras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 10, 24</bibl></cit>. — * </sense><sense id="n22399.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, rhet. t. t., the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)panadi/plwsis,</foreign> <bibl default="NO"><author>Rufin.</author> p. 234</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inclusor: <entryFree id="n22400" type="main" key="inclu_sor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inclūsor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22400.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who encloses</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enchases</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">auri atque gemmarum,</quote> <trans><tr>setter</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Jer. 5, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inclusus: <entryFree id="n22401" type="main" key="inclu_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inclūsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from includo.</entryFree>
inclutus: <entryFree id="n22402" type="main" key="inclu^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inclŭtus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">inclĭtus</orth> (not inclytus; the first syll. accented acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:48:159" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 48, 159</bibl>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-clueo; cf. the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kluto/s,</foreign> from <foreign lang="greek">klu/w,</foreign> much heard of, talked of, praised; hence</etym>, <sense id="n22402.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">celebrated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">renowned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">famous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">illustrious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glorious</hi> (syn.: nobilis, clarus; anteclass. and mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; not in Cæs. nor used by Cic.). </sense><sense id="n22402.1" n="A" level="2"> Of persons: hic occasus datu'st: at Horatius inclutu' saltu ..., Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=178" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 178</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 164 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">Jovi opulento, incluto, supremo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inclute Memmi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">3, 10: Ulixes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 197</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos quae in munditiis aetatulam agitis,... inclutae amicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dux inclutissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:4:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vates,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Saguntini, fide atque aerumnis incluti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 2, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:2:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 2, 1</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">familiae maxime inclitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 7, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22402.2" n="B" level="2"> Of things: augusto augurio postquam inclita condita Roma'st, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:1:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 1, 2</bibl> (Ann. v. 494 Vahl.): fanum Liberi, id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=14" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 14</bibl> Müll. (Trag. v. 170 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">moenia Dardanidum bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:241" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 241</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disciplina Lycurgi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:36:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 36, 4</bibl></cit>: inclutissima claritudo, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:7:19" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 7, 19</bibl>: judicium, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:50:114" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 50, 114</bibl> (Trag. v. 92 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">justitia religioque Numae Pompilii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maxime inclitum in terris oraculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:56:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 56, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inclitus magnitudine Atho mons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloria Palamedis famā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sagaris fluvius ex inclutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 1, 1, § 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aristotele ductore incluto omnium philosophorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:16:18" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 16, 18</bibl></cit>. — <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">incluta leti Lucretia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:821" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 821</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi> and <pos>adv.</pos> do not occur.</sense></entryFree>
inclytus: <entryFree id="n22403" type="main" key="incly^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inclytus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. inclutus.</entryFree>
incoactus: <entryFree id="n22404" type="main" key="inco^actus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-cŏactus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22404.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not compelled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">voluntary</hi> (post-Aug. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">omne honestum injussum incoactumque est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 66" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 66 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit> (false read. for incohata, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 7</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
incoctilis: <entryFree id="n22405" type="main" key="incocti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incoctĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>incoquo</etym>. * <sense id="n22405.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Cooked in</hi> any thing: incoctile <foreign lang="greek">e)neyhme/non,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.—* </sense><sense id="n22405.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">in-coctĭlĭa</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. vasa), <hi rend="ital">vessels overlaid</hi> or <hi rend="ital">washed with metal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tinned vessels</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 17, 48, § 162</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incoctio: <entryFree id="n22406" type="main" key="incocti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incoctĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22406.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a boiling in</hi> any thing, <hi rend="ital">an incoction</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:3:62" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 3, 62</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
