incoctus: <entryFree id="n22407" type="main" key="incoctus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incoctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from incoquo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n22408" type="main" key="incoctus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incoctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-coquo</etym>, <sense id="n22408.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">uncooked</hi>, <hi rend="ital">raw</hi> (ante-class. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">incoctum non expromet, bene coctum dabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collyrae facite ut madeant et colyphia: incocta ne mihi detis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: caro, Fab. Pict. ap. Gell. <cb n="INCO" /> 10, 15, 12.—Hence, fig.: incocto pure, <hi rend="ital">the bad humor not worked off</hi>, Hier. cont. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incoenatus: <entryFree id="n22409" type="main" key="incoenatus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incoenatus</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">incoenis</orth>, etc., v. incenatus, incenis, etc.</entryFree>
incoeptum: <entryFree id="n22410" type="main" key="incoeptum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incoeptum</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">incoepto</orth>, v. inceptum and incepto.</entryFree>
incoercitus: <entryFree id="n22411" type="main" key="incoercitus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incoercitus</orth>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-coërceo</etym>, <sense id="n22411.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unrestrained</hi>: incoercitos affectus, Jul. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:C. Saec. Jul. 4:41" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> C. Saec. Jul. 4, 41</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incogitabilis: <entryFree id="n22412" type="main" key="inco_gi^ta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-cōgĭtābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n22412.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thoughtless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inconsiderate</hi> (ante- and post - class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nunc demum scio, me fuisse excordem, caecum, incogitabilem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n22412.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inconceivable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incomprehensible</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">immensitas efficientiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 922</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dementia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 3</bibl></cit>: incogitabile est, eandem esse causam, etc., Fragm. Jur. Civ. p. 23 Mai.</sense></entryFree>
incogitans: <entryFree id="n22413" type="main" key="inco_gi^tans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incōgĭtans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-cogito</etym>, <sense id="n22413.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">thoughtless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inconsiderate</hi> (ante- and postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">ni fuissem incogitans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adeon' te esse incogitantem atque impudentem, ut? etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Sap. Periandr. 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incogitantia: <entryFree id="n22414" type="hapax" key="inco_gi^tanti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incōgĭtantĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>incogitans</etym>, <sense id="n22414.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">thoughtlessness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inconsiderateness</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 1, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incogitatus: <entryFree id="n22415" type="main" key="inco_gi^ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incōgĭtātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-cogito</etym>. <sense id="n22415.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unconsidered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unstudied</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:23" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 23 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alacritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incogitata dicere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 364</bibl></cit> (de Deo. Soc. p. 102 Hild.).—</sense><sense id="n22415.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thoughtless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inconsiderate</hi> (ante- and postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne incogitati dicere cogerentur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incogito: <entryFree id="n22416" type="hapax" key="inco_gi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-cōgĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n22416.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to think of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contrive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">design</hi> ( = intendere, moliri; perh. formed after the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)nnoei=n</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">fraudem socio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 122</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incognitus: <entryFree id="n22417" type="main" key="incogni^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-cognĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n22417.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Not examined</hi>, <hi rend="ital">untried</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestra solum legitis, vestra amatis, ceteros causā incognitā condemnatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:29:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 29, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caec. 10, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22417.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Not known</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unknown</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">esp. freq. in Cic.): ne incognita pro cognitis habeamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:6:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insperatum omnibus consilium, incognitum certe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 4, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">falsa aut incognita res,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 12, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">effata fatidicorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:8:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 8, 20</bibl></cit>: quae omnia fere Gallis erant incognita, Caes, B. G. 4, 20, 3; so with <case>dat.</case>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 29, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 3, 10, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">biduum ad recognoscendas res datum dominis, tertio incognita sub hasta veniere,</quote> <trans><tr>unclaimed</tr>, <tr>not identified by the owners</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:16:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 16, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui incognitum famae aperuerint armis orbem terrarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:52:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 52, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palus oculis incognita nostris,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>unseen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum incognitum (eum) alias haberet,</quote> <trans><tr>did not know</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94</bibl></cit>: nihil ejusmodi invenio; <cit><quote lang="la">itaque incognito nimirum assentiar,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 35, 113</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 36, 114</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contineo igitur me, ne incognito assentiar,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 43, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rebecca incognita viro,</quote> <trans><tr>a maiden</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:24:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 24, 16</bibl></cit>: longi mensura incognita nervi, <hi rend="ital">unknown</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">unparalleled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">greater than any known</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:34" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incognoscibilis: <entryFree id="n22418" type="main" key="incognosci^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-cognoscĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22418.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">incomprehensible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not to be known</hi> or <hi rend="ital">discerned</hi>: Deus, Hilar. in Psa. 143, 8.</sense></entryFree>
incognosco: <entryFree id="n22419" type="hapax" key="incognosco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-cognosco</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <sense id="n22419.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to learn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">find out</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">ut incognosceret, quisnam esset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 362, 22</bibl></cit> (dub. al. ut inde cognosceret).</sense></entryFree>
incohamenta: <entryFree id="n22420" type="main" key="inco^ha_menta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incŏhāmenta</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">incho-</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>incoho</etym>, <sense id="n22420.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">first principles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rudiments</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elements</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 576</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">incohamentorum primordia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, § 437 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
incohatio: <entryFree id="n22421" type="main" key="inco^ha_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incŏhātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">incho-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22421.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a beginning</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 120 al" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 120 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
incohativus: <entryFree id="n22422" type="main" key="inco^ha_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incŏhātīvus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">incho-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22422.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">beginning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">denoting a beginning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inchoative;</hi> in gram.: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 223</bibl></cit> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 333</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 824</bibl> P. et saep.</sense></entryFree>
incohator: <entryFree id="n22423" type="main" key="inco^ha_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incŏhātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">incho-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n22423.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a beginner</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">mortis (Cain),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 27 praef.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
incohibeo: <entryFree id="n22424" type="spur" key="inco^hi^beo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incŏhĭbeo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, false read. in Lncr. 3, 444, inst. of is cohibessit; v. Lachm. ad h. l.</entryFree>
incohibilis: <entryFree id="n22425" type="main" key="inco^hi^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incŏhĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-cohibeo</etym>, <sense id="n22425.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be held</hi> or <hi rend="ital">kept together</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">illo genere oneris tam impedito ac tam incohibili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:3:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22425.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That cannot be restrained</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 24, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 2</bibl></cit>. <cb n="INCO" /></sense></entryFree>
incoho: <entryFree id="n22426" type="main" key="incoho"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incoho</orth> (better than <orth extent="full" lang="la">inchŏo</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 95</bibl>; cf. Corss. Ausspr. 1, 109; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 35</bibl> Mai.; 3, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:page=154" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> p. 154</bibl> Rom.; Marin. Fratr. Arv. p. 363; Bramb. p. 291 sq.), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>for in-coco; from in and Sanscr. root kuk-, to take, grasp</etym>. <sense id="n22426.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to lay the foundation of</hi> a thing, <hi rend="ital">to begin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commence</hi> (syn. incipere; opp. absolvere, perficere; class.). </sense><sense id="n22426.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n22426.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut Phidias potest a primo instituere signum idque perficere, potest ab alio incohatum accipere et absolvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:13:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 13, 34</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nemo pictor esset inventus, qui Coae Veneris eam partem, quam Apelles incohatam reliquisset, absolveret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:2:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 2, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 7, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:1:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res in animis nostris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:16:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 16, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas res nos in consulatu nostro gessimus, attigit hic versibus atque incohavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:11:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 11, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophiam multis locis incohasti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod mihi nuper in Tusculano incohasti de oratoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:5:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 5, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod hic liber incohat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:1:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc materiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4 praef" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4 praef.</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">5: abrupto, quem incohaverat, sermone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:3:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse videatur octonarium incohat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">referamus nos igitur ad eum, quem volumus incohandum et eloquentia informandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:9:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 9, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Favonius ver incohans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 25, 39, § 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incohandae vindemiae dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 14, 14, § 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulcherrimum facinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum Stygio regi nocturnas incohat aras,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>begins to sacrifice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:252" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 252</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reges plures incohantur, ne desint,</quote> <trans><tr>are chosen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 16, 16, § 51</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22426.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam si mens fieri proponit et incohat ipsa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 183</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 174</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Dec. 2</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n22426.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic., pregn. in the <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">incŏhātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">only begun</hi> (opp. to finished, completed), <hi rend="ital">unfinished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incomplete</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imperfect</hi> (mostly Ciceron.): <cit><quote lang="la">ne hanc incohatam transigam comoediam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui exaedificaret suam incohatam ignaviam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae adulescentulis nobis ex commentariolis nostris incohata ac rudia exciderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cognitio manca atque incohata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:43:153" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 43, 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incohatum quiddam et confusum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem tam praeclaram incohatam relinquere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:20:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 20, 56</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perfecta anteponuntur incohatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:18:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 18, 69</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc incohati cujusdam officii est, non perfecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:6:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 6, 15</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22426.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to begin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take a beginning.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22426.6" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">moris est, ut munus hujusmodi a proficiscentibus incohat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 7:75" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 7, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incohante mense,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 25, 20</bibl></cit> and 33.— * </sense><sense id="n22426.7" n="B" level="2"> In partic., like infit, <hi rend="ital">to begin to speak</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">post longa silentia rursus Incohat Ismene,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:623" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 623</bibl></cit>. — Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">incōhātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">incipiently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incompletely</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Gen. ad Lit. 6:11" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Gen. ad Lit. 6, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incoinquinabiliter: <entryFree id="n22427" type="main" key="incoinqui^na_bi^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incoinquĭnābĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>in-coinquinabilis</etym> (eccl. Lat.), Aug. de Nat. Boni, 44.</entryFree>
incoinquinatus: <entryFree id="n22428" type="main" key="inco^inqui^na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-cŏinquĭnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22428.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unde filed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unpolluted</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 13</bibl></cit>; Ambros. Apol. David, 11, 56.</sense></entryFree>
incola: <entryFree id="n22429" type="main" key="inco^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> (<gen>f.</gen> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 6, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 642</bibl>) [in-colo], <sense id="n22429.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an inhabitant</hi> of a place, <hi rend="ital">a resident.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22429.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">optati cives, populares, incolae, accolae, advenae omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: incola est, qui in aliquam regionem domicilium suum contulit, quem Graeci <foreign lang="greek">pa/roikon</foreign> appellant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:239" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 239</bibl>: opp. civis; peregrini autem atque incolae officium est, etc., <hi rend="ital">a foreign resident</hi> ( = Gr. <foreign lang="greek">me/toikos</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:34:125" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 34, 125</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Tarquinium, non Romanae modo sed ne Italicae quidem gentis, . . incolam a Tarquiniis ... regem factum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incola et his magistratibus parere debet, apud quos incola est, et illis, apud quos civis est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:1:29" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 1, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:11:section=26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 11, § 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 58, § 130</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt enim e terra homines, non ut incolae atque habitatores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:56:140" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 56, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Coloneus ille locus cujus incola Sophocles ob oculos versabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Socrates) totius mundi se incolam et civem arbitrabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:37:108" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 37, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audiebam Pythagoram Pythagoreosque incolas paene nostros,</quote> <trans><tr>almost our countrymen</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 21, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pergama, Incola captivo quae bove victor alat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 1, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phryx,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:976" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 976</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Idumæae Syrophoenix portae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:160" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 160</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, in apposition, or <pb n="925" /> <cb n="INCO" /> <pos>adj.</pos>, Cameren incola turba vocat, <hi rend="ital">the natives</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:582" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 582</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n22429.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of animals and inanimate things: <cit><quote lang="la">aquarum incolae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:13:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 13, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rana stagni incola,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novum incolam (piscem) mari dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 17, 29, § 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (arbores) incolarum numero esse coepere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>indigenous</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 3, 7, § 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Addua, Ticinus, Mincius, omnes Padi incolae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>flowing into the Po</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 19, 23, § 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me Porrectum ante fores obicere incolis Plorares aquilonibus,</quote> <trans><tr>native</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 10, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incolatus: <entryFree id="n22430" type="main" key="inco^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incŏlātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>2. incolo</etym>, <sense id="n22430.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a resid?*!ing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a dwelling in</hi> a place (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:1:34" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 1, 34</bibl>; Cod. Th. 12, 1, 5; 12 al.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3725</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n22430.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">per incolatum Spiritus Sancti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incolo: <entryFree id="n22431" type="main" key="inco^lo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-cŏlo</orth>, <itype>lŭi, 3</itype> (post-class. collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">incŏlo</orth>, āre: <sense id="n22431.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">paradisum incolare et custodire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; whence incolatus), <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n22431.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (for the simple colere), <hi rend="ital">to cultivate</hi> (late Lat.): in his terris, quas incolunt (rusticani), Cod. Th. 13, 1, 3. — </sense><sense id="n22431.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to dwell</hi> or <hi rend="ital">abide in</hi> a place, <hi rend="ital">to inhabit</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n22431.3" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> (only so in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">jam qui incolunt eas (sc. maritimas) urbes, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illam urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:10:section=21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 10, § 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 45, 137</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Delum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:17:section=46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 17, § 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illos lacus lucosque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 72</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">188: eos agros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eam partem terrae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">terras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:16:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 16, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:6:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea loca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unam, aliam, tertiam partem Galliae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alpes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 10, 3</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">eamdem patriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">piscibus atque avibus ferisque, quae incolunt terras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 12, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secessum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">indulgens templa vetustis Incolere atque habitare deis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:672" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 672</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">e locis quoque ipsis, qui a quibusque incolebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:42:93" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 42, 93</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 44, 92</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n22431.4" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Neptuno, qui salsis locis incolit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Germani, qui trans Rhenum incolunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cis Rhenum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remanere uno in loco incolendi causa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui inter mare Alpesque incolebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat oppidum Vaga, ubi et incolere et mercari consueverant multi mortales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 47:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 47, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n22432" type="main" key="inco^lo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incŏlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. 1. incolo <sense id="n22432.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
incolor: <entryFree id="n22433" type="gloss" key="inco^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-cŏlor</orth> <foreign lang="greek">a)/xroos</foreign> (<sense id="n22433.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">colorless</hi>), Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
incolorate: <entryFree id="n22434" type="hapax" key="inco^lo_ra_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incŏlōrātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>2. in-coloratus: without coloring or palliation, i. e.</etym>, <sense id="n22434.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">without alleging a cause</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:4:18" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 4, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incolumis: <entryFree id="n22435" type="main" key="inco^lu^mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-cŏlŭmis</orth>, <itype>e</itype> (<sense id="n22435.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi> regularly incolumi; incolume, Pomp. and Cic. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 108</bibl> P.), <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">unimpaired</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uninjured</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in good condition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">still alive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">safe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whole</hi> (class. and freq.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: salvus, intactus, integer): urbem et cives integros incolumesque servavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salvum atque incolumem exercitum transducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:32:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 32, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 72, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:8:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 8, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut haec retinere per populum Romanum incolumia ac salva possimus, id. Div. ap. Caccil. 22, 72: ut salvae et incolumes sint civitates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:56:169" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 56, 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valeant cives mei: sint incolumes, sint florentes, sint beati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:34:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 34, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in omni honore incolumem habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:21:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 21, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:47:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 47, 136</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sortium beneficio se esse incolumem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 53 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incolumes ad unum omnes in castra perveniunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 40, 4</bibl></cit>: quo stante et incolume, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 108</bibl> P.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">incolume illo, Pomp. Fragm. ib.: omnibus navibus ad unam incolumibus milites exposuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita ut sit data Incolumem (dotem) sistere ei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum hoc actutum incolume redigam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 2, 5, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(arx) incolumis atque intacta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incolumes non redeunt genae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 10, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla incolumi relicta re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:14:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 14, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:2:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 2, 13</bibl></cit>. — With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a calamitate judicii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audacia,</quote> <trans><tr>unshaken</tr>, <tr>unsubdued</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 5, 14</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: deteriores sunt incolumiores, Quadrig. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:2:16" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 2, 16</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> and <pos>adv.</pos> do not occur.</sense></entryFree>
incolumitas: <entryFree id="n22436" type="main" key="inco^lu^mi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incŏlŭmĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>incolumis</etym>, <sense id="n22436.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">good condition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soundness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">safety</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">incolumitas est salutis tuta atque integra conservatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:56:169" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 56, 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in incolumitate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Post Red. ad Quir. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: concordi <cb n="INCO" /> populo et omnia referenti ad incolumitatem et ad libertatem suam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 32</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">incolumitatem ac libertatem retinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:56:168" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 56, 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deditis pollicebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 28, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 46 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>— In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:14:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 14, 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 52</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incomis: <entryFree id="n22437" type="main" key="inco_mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-cōmis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22437.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unpleasant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 7 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">incōmĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">ungracefully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without pleasantry</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud incomiter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:8:4" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 8, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incomitatus: <entryFree id="n22438" type="main" key="inco^mi^ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-cŏmĭtātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22438.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unaccompanied</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unattended</hi> (rare and mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic., for in de Or. 1, 55, 234, the correct read. is incompta): virginibus in Illyrico incomitatis vagari licet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:10:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 10, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1225</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">externis virtus incomitata bonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:3:35" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 3, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestigia ferre,</quote> <trans><tr>to go without company</tr>, <tr>alone</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:101" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 101</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incomitem: <entryFree id="n22439" type="gloss" key="inco^mi^tem"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incŏmĭtem</orth> <itype>sine comite</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=107" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 107</bibl> Müll.; cf. incomitatus.</entryFree>
incomitio: <entryFree id="n22440" type="main" key="inco^mi^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-cŏmĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, prob. <sense id="n22440.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to insult</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reproach in public</hi>: incomitiare significat tale convicium facere, pro quo necesse sit in comitium, hoc est in conventum venire. Plautus (Curc. 3, 40): quaeso ne me incomities, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=107" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 107</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">licetne inforare, si incomitiare hau licet?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 3, 1, 31</bibl></cit>; cf. sqq.</sense></entryFree>
incomium: <entryFree id="n22441" type="hapax" key="incomi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incomĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n22441.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the ingredients of an ointment</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 6, 28, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incomma: <entryFree id="n22442" type="main" key="incomma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incomma</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">encomma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">e)/gkomma,</foreign> an incision, mark; hence</etym>, <sense id="n22442.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the standard height</hi> of soldiers, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 1, 5</bibl>; Hier. in. Jovin. 2, 34; cf.: incomma mensura militum, Gloss. Isid.</sense></entryFree>
incommeabilis: <entryFree id="n22443" type="main" key="incomme^a_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-commĕābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22443.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not traversable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impassable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">via,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 11, 8</bibl></cit> (al. difficiles).</sense></entryFree>
incommendatus: <entryFree id="n22444" type="hapax" key="incommenda_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-commendātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22444.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unrecommended;</hi> <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">given up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abandoned</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus, sc. ventis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:435" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 435</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incomminatus: <entryFree id="n22445" type="spur" key="incommi^na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incommĭnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, false read. in <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 10, p. 241</bibl>, for in comminata.</entryFree>
incomminutus: <entryFree id="n22446" type="main" key="incommi^nu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incommĭnūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. incomminuo</etym>, <sense id="n22446.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not broken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entire</hi>: ut fundamentum immobilis, tamquam adamas incomminutus, (Hilar.) Anon. in Job, 2, p. 137.</sense></entryFree>
incommiscibilis: <entryFree id="n22447" type="main" key="incommisci^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-commiscĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22447.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be mixed</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">animus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incommobilitas: <entryFree id="n22448" type="main" key="incommo_bi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-commōbĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n22448.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">immovableness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insensibility;</hi> a transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)orghsi/a,</foreign> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 2, 14, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incommode: <entryFree id="n22449" type="main" key="incommo^de_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incommŏdē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. incommodus <sense id="n22449.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
incommodesticus: <entryFree id="n22450" type="hapax" key="incommo^desti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incommŏdestĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, a comically formed word for incommodus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 1, 19</bibl>.</entryFree>
incommoditas: <entryFree id="n22451" type="main" key="incommo^di^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incommŏdĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>incommodus</etym>, <sense id="n22451.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inconvenience</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incommodiousness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unsuitableness; disadvantage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">damage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loss</hi>, <hi rend="ital">injury</hi> (mostly ante- and post-class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: incommodum, molestia, difficultas): incommoditas denique huc omnis redit (opp. commoditates),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 3, 35</bibl></cit>: in ista incommoditate alienati illius animi et offensi illud inest tamen commodi, quod, etc., * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 17, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">temporis,</quote> <trans><tr>unseasonableness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: incommoditate abstinere me apud convivas commodo commemini, <hi rend="ital">impropriety</hi>, Plant. Mil. 3, 1, 49. — In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 59</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 54</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3</bibl>. 125.</sense></entryFree>
incommodo: <entryFree id="n22452" type="main" key="incommo^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incommŏdo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n22452.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [id.]. </sense><sense id="n22452.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to occasion inconvenience</hi> or <hi rend="ital">trouble</hi> to any one, <hi rend="ital">to be inconvenient</hi>, <hi rend="ital">troublesome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">annoying</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui nihil,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 16, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:3:section=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 3, § 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsa scientia, etiam si incommodatura sit, gaudeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:19:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 19, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 8, p. 202, 10</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">obnoxium eum dici, cui quid ab eo, cui esse obnoxius dicitur, incommodari et noceri potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:17:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 17, 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22452.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to render inconvenient</hi> or <hi rend="ital">troublesome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to incommode</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">si quid aliud fiat, quod navigationem incommodet, difficiliorem faciat, vel prorsus impediat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:12:1:section=15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 12, 1, § 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si incommodatur ad usum manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:14:section=6" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 21, 1, 14, § 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:21:1:section=1" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 43, 21, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incommodum: <entryFree id="n22453" type="main" key="incommo^dum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incommŏdum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. incommodus, II.</entryFree>
incommodus: <entryFree id="n22454" type="main" key="incommo^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-commŏdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22454.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inconvenient</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unsuitable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unfit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unseasonable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">troublesome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disagreeable.</hi> </sense><sense id="n22454.1" n="I" level="1"> <pos>Adj.</pos> </sense><sense id="n22454.2" n="A" level="2"> Of things (class. and freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 2, 27</bibl></cit>: valetudo, Cic. <cb n="INCO" /> <bibl default="NO"><author>Brut.</author> 34, 130</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">colloquium pro re nata non incommodum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne voce quidem incommodā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:14:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 14, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">severitas morum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:31:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 31, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conflictatio turbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:16" default="NO">1, 7, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eorum controversiam non incommodum videtur cum utrorumque ratione exponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:34:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 34, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves propugnatoribus incommodae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:10:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 10, 15</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut actori incommodior esset exhibitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:4:11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 10, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: incommodioris condicionis homines, Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 15, 3, 1. — <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in rebus ejus incommodissimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:59:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 59, 161</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n22454.3" n="B" level="2"> Of persons, <hi rend="ital">troublesome</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid huic responde, commode, ne incommodus nobis sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 189</bibl></cit> (but not in Bacch. 3, 2, 17; <cit><quote lang="la">v. Ritschl ad h. l.): idem facilem et liberalem patrem incommodum esse amanti filio disputat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:29:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 29, 73</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n22454.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">incommŏdum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">inconvenience</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trouble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disadvantage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">detriment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">injury</hi>, <hi rend="ital">misfortune</hi> (freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quom ejus incommodum tam aegre feras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostro incommodo detrimentoque, si est ita necesse, doleamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:1:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui locus est talis, ut plus habeat adjumenti quam incommodi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:24:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 24, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non modo incommodi nihil ceperunt, sed etiam ... in quaestu sunt versati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:46:section=109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 46, § 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timet, ne ipse aliquo afficiatur incommodo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:7:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accidit repentinum incommodum: tanta enim tempestas cooritur, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:48:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 48, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab officio abduci incommodo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:2:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 2, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">ellipt.: nec id incommodo tuo (sc. feceris),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:47:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 47, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae res magnum nostris attulit incommodum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:63:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 63, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid iniquitas loci habeat incommodi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:45:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 45, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid importetur nobis incommodi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:5:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex eo concursu navium magnum esse incommodum acceptum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut acceptum incommodum virtute sarciretur (shortly before: detrimentum acceptum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:73:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 73, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reiciendi, deminuendi, devitandive incommodi causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:5:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 5, 18</bibl></cit>: incommodum inter eos (socios) commune est, <hi rend="ital">loss</hi> (opp. lucrum), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:150" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 150</bibl>.—Rarely with <hi rend="ital">gen. rei</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">commoveri incommodo valetudinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 7, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">morbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:23:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 23, 47</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">multis incommodis difficultatibusque affectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 3, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:13:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 13, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot incommodis conflictati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:35:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 35, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 10, 6</bibl>.— With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>diseases</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 17, 102, § 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulmonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 7, 21, § 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vesicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 12, 101, § 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferre incommoda vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:21" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 21</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n22454.5" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">incommŏdē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">inconveniently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incommodiously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unfortunately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unseasonably</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fores Hae sonitu suo moram mihi obiciunt incommode,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 5, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">posse pro re nata te non incommode ad me in Albanum venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:33:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 33, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 8, 6</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum illo quidem actum optime est: mecum incommodius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:4:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 4, 15</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">incommodissime navigare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 9, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incommote: <entryFree id="n22455" type="hapax" key="incommo_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incommōtē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>2. in-commotus</etym>, <sense id="n22455.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">immovably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unchangeably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">firmly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">permanere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 1, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incommunicabilis: <entryFree id="n22456" type="main" key="incommu_ni^ca_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-commūnĭcābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22456.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">incommunicable</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:14:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 14, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incommunicatus: <entryFree id="n22457" type="main" key="incommu_ni^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incommūnĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>incommunico</etym>, <sense id="n22457.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">shared with</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alteri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. 1:13" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. 1, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incommunis: <entryFree id="n22458" type="main" key="incommu_nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-commūnis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22458.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not common</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">incommunes ceteris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:9:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 9, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incommutabilis: <entryFree id="n22459" type="main" key="incommu_ta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-commūtābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22459.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unchangeable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immutable</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">omnia verbi principia incommutabilia viderentur (opp. commutabilia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=99" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 99</bibl></cit> Müll.: status rei publicae, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:33:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 33, 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Retract. 1:9" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Retract. 1, 9</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">in-commūtābĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">unchangeably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immutably</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 3:3" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Trin. 7:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Trin. 7, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incommutabilitas: <entryFree id="n22460" type="main" key="incommu_ta_bi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incommūtābĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>incommutabilis</etym>, <sense id="n22460.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unchangeableness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immutability</hi> (late Lat.); <cit><quote lang="la">with aeternitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 12:12" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 12, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incommutabiliter: <entryFree id="n22461" type="main" key="incommu_ta_bi^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incommūtābĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. incommutabilis <sense id="n22461.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
incommutatus: <entryFree id="n22462" type="main" key="incommu_ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incommūtātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. incommuto</etym>,<pb n="926" /> <cb n="INCO" />  <sense id="n22462.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unchangeable</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> de Manich. 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incomparabilis: <entryFree id="n22463" type="main" key="incompa^ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-compărābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22463.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be equalled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incomparable</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">sublimitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 25, 26, § 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magister,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 11</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">freq. in epitaphs: MARITO, CONIVGI, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 486, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">432, 8</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: divinitatis gloria, Ambros. de Isaac et An. 8, 78; cf. in <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: ALVMNO KARISSIMO ET INCOMPARABILISSIMO, Inscr. ap. Fabr. p. 147 <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 183.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">incompărābĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">incomparably</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 21, 9; id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 67, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incomparatus: <entryFree id="n22464" type="gloss" key="incompa^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incompărātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-, 1. comparo</etym>, <sense id="n22464.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unequalled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incomparable</hi>, for incomparabilis, as an epithet of one deceased: CONIVGI INCOMPARATISSIMO, Inscr. ap. Fabr. p. 421, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 386.</sense></entryFree>
incompassibilis: <entryFree id="n22465" type="main" key="incompassi^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-compassĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22465.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot suffer with another</hi>, <hi rend="ital">share another</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s sufferings</hi> (eccl. Lat.): Pater, Tert. ap. Prax. 29.</sense></entryFree>
incompellabilis: <entryFree id="n22466" type="main" key="incompella_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incompellābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype> <etym>2. in-, 2. compello</etym>, <sense id="n22466.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be named</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not to be addressed by name</hi> (eccl. Lat.), Rufin. Invect. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> 2, 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
incompertus: <entryFree id="n22467" type="main" key="incompertus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-compertus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22467.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of which one has no information</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unknown</hi> (not anteAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">inter cetera vetustate incomperta hoc quoque in incerto positum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 23, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid incompertum deferret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:40:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 40, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:26:15" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 26, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">origo atque natura ejus incomperta est mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 13, 38, § 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qualis sit ea incompertum habeo,</quote> <trans><tr>I do not know</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 8, 16, § 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incompetens: <entryFree id="n22468" type="main" key="incompe^tens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-compĕtens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22468.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">insufficient</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 2, 17</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">in-compĕtenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">insufficiently</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 3, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 5, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incomplebilis: <entryFree id="n22469" type="gloss" key="incomple_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incomplēbĭlis</orth> <foreign lang="greek">a)plh/rwtos,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</entryFree>
incompletus: <entryFree id="n22470" type="main" key="incomple_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-complētus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22470.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">uncompleted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incomplete</hi> (late Lat.): consilia, Firm. Math. 5, 2.</sense></entryFree>
incomplexus: <entryFree id="n22471" type="gloss" key="incomplexus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incomplexus</orth> <foreign lang="greek">a)peri/lhptos,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</entryFree>
incompos: <entryFree id="n22472" type="main" key="incompos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incompos</orth>, <itype>ŏtis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-compos</etym>, <sense id="n22472.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not having control over</hi> (late Lat.): incompotem mentis hominem, [App.] Polem. Physiog. p. 125.</sense></entryFree>
incomposite: <entryFree id="n22473" type="main" key="incompo^si^te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incompŏsĭtē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. incompositus <sense id="n22473.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
incompositus: <entryFree id="n22474" type="main" key="incompo^si^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-compŏsĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n22474.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Not compounded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">simple</hi>, Ambros. Hexaëm. 1, 7, 25; Boëth. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> Arith. 1, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">trinitas incompositae naturae corrumpi non potest,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 81, 8</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22474.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Not well put together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not properly arranged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">out of order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disordered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disarranged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discomposed</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n22474.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:28:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 28, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes (opp. compositi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 38 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">det motus incompositos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:350" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 350</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22474.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of style: <cit><quote lang="la">incomposito dixi pede currere versus Lucili,</quote> <trans><tr>disordered</tr>, <tr>irregular</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortius quid incompositum potest esse, quam vinctum et bene collocatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib. 32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rudibus et incompositis similia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib. 17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Aeschylus) rudis in plerisque et incompositus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 66</bibl></cit>: moribus incompositus, id 4, 5, 10. — <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">incompŏ-sĭtē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">without order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disorderly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">veniens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:37:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 37, 11</bibl></cit>.—Of speech: <cit><quote lang="la">qui horride atque incomposite illud extulerunt,</quote> <trans><tr>without order</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 2, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
incomprehensibilis: <entryFree id="n22475" type="main" key="incompre^hensi^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incomprĕhensĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. incomprehendo</etym>, <sense id="n22475.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be seized</hi> or <hi rend="ital">held</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that cannot be grasped</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n22475.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvitas arenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10 praef" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10 praef.</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">4: alces incomprehensibili fuga pollet,</quote> <trans><tr>that cannot be overtaken</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 20</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">constare ex comprehensibili et incomprehensibili,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Ap. 48</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n22475.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n22475.3" n="A" level="2"> (The fig. is of a wrestler.) In disputando incomprehensibilis et lubricus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:20:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 6</bibl> Döring.— </sense><sense id="n22475.4" n="B" level="2"> Of the mind, <hi rend="ital">incomprehensible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inconceivable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitiosae consuetudinis immensum et incomprehensibile arbitrium est,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>illimitable</tr>, <tr>endless</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Helv. 11:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Helv. 11, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.<cit><quote lang="la">, opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 94:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 94, 14</bibl></cit>: cum igitur illa incerta (natura) incomprehensibilisque sit, <hi rend="ital">incomprehensible</hi>, Cels. praef. <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecepta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 12</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">in-comprĕhensĭbĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">incomprehensibly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 87</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 2, 1</bibl>: natus filius, Hilar. Trin. 3, 17; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 2, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
incomprehensus: <entryFree id="n22476" type="main" key="incompre^hensus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-comprĕhensus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22476.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not comprehended</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incomprehensible</hi> (post-class.): <cb n="INCO" /> manet virtus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ap. 821</bibl>. (In <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 29, 95</bibl>, the correct reading is non comprehensa.)</sense></entryFree>
incompte: <entryFree id="n22477" type="main" key="incompte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">incomptē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">incomtē</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. incomptus <sense id="n22477.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
incomptus: <entryFree id="n22478" type="main" key="incomptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-comptus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">incomt-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n22478.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unadorned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inelegant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">artless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rude</hi> (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n22478.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">incomptis Curium capillis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 41</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:789" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 789</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:16" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 16</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">nuda, nudis incompta capillis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 261</bibl></cit>.— In <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">incomptiore capillo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:69" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 69</bibl></cit>: ungues, <hi rend="ital">unpared</hi>, <hi rend="ital">untrimmed</hi>, Cic. Ac. Fragm. ap. Aug. contr. Acad. 3, 7, IV. 2, p. 471 Orell.: <cit><quote lang="la">apparatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 14</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n22478.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of speech: <cit><quote lang="la">ut mulieres esse dicuntur nonnallae inornatae, quas id ipsum deceat: sic haec subtilis oratio, quasi incompta delectat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:23:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 23, 78</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:55:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 55, 234</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuda sit et velut incompta oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:41" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:41:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 41, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">coloni versibus incomptis ludunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:386" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 386</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(versus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:446" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 446</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">incomptē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">roughly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inelegantly</hi> (post-class. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">dolantur stipites,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:5:34" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 5, 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
